Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bklady
Reviews.Content: I recently visited for a conference and was enchanted by the beautiful city of San Diego. We were lucky enough to stay here and had a wonderful time. We arrived early in the morning and expected to stow our luggage and go until check-in, but the staff found a room for us. All the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Bryan F. at the Tapatini was very charming and one of the hardest-working guys I've seen. The location on the Marina is lovely. It is a jaunt to downtown (about 2.5 miles), but it's a pretty walk. The Old Town Trolley does make a stop here in the morning and is a great way to explore the city. There is also a car rental place not too far. I would certainly return to this beautiful hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kaleichitose
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried due to the varied reviews of the property. I had a great experience all around, particularly in all of the areas that seemed to have been problems for other visitors. It might have been the time of year, though as I know busy seasons tend to show in the service one receives. Hospitality was professional and friendly, room was clean (I immediately checked everything that other guests had reported problems with - bathrooms, carpet, linens, which were all spotless). Room service was prompt (even faster than they promised for one dinner on a Friday night!), food was good. I upgraded to a Club room which was totally worth it. Beautiful view and room, great Club food and drink, along with ambience of the Club. Again, may have been time of year because everything was quite smooth and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: PoppyandDeeDee
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel to hold a conference. It is convienent to the airport but once there you must take an expensive cab to go anywhere. The hotel food is expensive , $10.00 for a bowl of oatmeal! If you want to eat anywhere else, you must take a cab. It is NOT close to any other services. Internet is ONLY available for a charge of 11.95 per Day in your room. The lobby does have free wireless but only had about two plugs which was very inadequate for 1000 peopke attending a conference. I would not reccommend holding a conference here - you may pay a little bit more to be downtown but you will not have to take a cab and you will have better food choices

Reviews.Title: “great view, lots of little annoyances”
Reviews.Author: runwoman
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, I booked a room in the Bay Tower. The view was awesome...but there were other minor things that detracted from my stay. (1) The water for my shower was only lukewarm 2 out of 3 mornings. (2) The walls are paper thin. I could hear people talking next door & in the hall, also heard every time people in the room above flushed the toilet (they are VERY loud), walked, & took a shower, etc. (3) The website doesn't state that it's about 1/4 to 1/3 mile walk from the Bay Tower to the Marina Tower where the main hotel and larger conference venue are located. I love to walk...but not in business shoes. (4) Food prices at the hotel restaurants are about the most outrageous I've ever seen, even for a higher-end hotel in a major city. $9 for a bowl of oatmeal?! $15 for a hamburger?! Thankfully the deli/diner half-way between the 2 buildings had great, inexpensive food for breakfast & lunch. If you are going for a conference, I'd recommend staying at the Marina for convenience sake, unless the view is all that matters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timpanimom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. A beautiful water view. It is close to Symphony Hall and the location of the San Diego Opera. It is about 2 miles from center city where there are lots of things to see. You must go to the San Diego Zoo if you have children. Our children live in San Diego and this hotel is a good place to stay and get around the city with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great room convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: NatRinPDX
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel for last-minute travel to San Diego. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful harbor views and the crisp, clean, nautical themed rooms. Although our room faced the parking lot, the balcony was nice in the mornings to get some sunshine and fresh air. One night we returned from dinner to our room smelling of cigarette smoke. When my husband opened the sliding door to see if it was someone outside, the smell came rushing in. Since it's a non-smoking property, I called the front desk and they immediately sent up security. The gentleman was there in 2 minutes and agreed that the room was not suitable. Within 5 minutes of my initial call they promptly moved us to another room on the opposite side of the building. Excellent customer service from a rather irritating situation!

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: PandaMaiNium
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, the views even better. We had a room that had a view of the marina and the San Diego bay cityline. The nighttime view of the city lights was great. Rooms were well appointed, comfortable bed, clean updated room and bathrooms, even have Peter Thomas Roth bath amenities (as a woman, I appreciated this very much! ^_^) It was a short trip to get downtown, SD Zoo and Seaworld and not too bad to Coronado as well, where we had dinner plans one evening. There is also a hotel restaurant for convenience. Across the hotel is a walking path by the water which was also nice. The area has restaurants and bars within walking distance and is also by the airport (which is good for plane watching or aviation photography -my fiance enjoyed it) Overall it was a great place to stay. Nice, clean convenient and parking was not far nor crowded and it was fairly cheaper than downtown hotel parking. I would give it 5 stars except the room we had was a bit small. King bed and furniture with one large suitcase had us walking over our stuff to get to the bathroom. But traveling as a couple, I wasn't bothered much by it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service near airport.”
Reviews.Author: Sunblader
Reviews.Content: A very busy hotel with lots of features including a massive lagoon pool and new fitness equipment. The pub-style restaurant bar is nice and the waitstaff are excellent. Just very over-priced for a pub however the food was very good. The main restaurant has a great buffet breakfast and the service was wonderful. Rooms were very clean and the hotel has stunning views if you're lucky enough to get into the marina building. Really nice hot tub that is quite large and actually HOT. Too bad the pool was so cold. Great hotel and the staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, nice location...”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyMan
Reviews.Content: Right next to the airport and situated on the bay this hotel has picture perfect views of the city from one side and views of a marina and Point Loma peninsula on the other when you stay in the main tower. The rooms are bright and clean, the decks offer great views, the pools are large and inviting, and the location is a short cab ride to the city. The in-room dining choices are limited, but service is fast. There's a bar restaurant in the lobby that offers decent food at decent prices. There are conference facilities in this hotel, so if you're looking to avoid corporate crowds this may not be the place for you. Overall I was very happy with the four days I just spent here and want to come back again to see more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around!”
Reviews.Author: Candy J
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to the airport. Great little sandwich shop between the to buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - if have car - terrible hotel service”
Reviews.Author: CarouselCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Bay Tower," which is a separate building, around the corner about 1/2 mile from the main building. The Bay Tower used to be a Ramada...and still looks like it. We were unable to check in early, were told they put a pending on our room to clean first, so we could check in after flying for 8 hours, and would call us. They never called, so we checked in at 2:50 pm, only to be given a room we did not choose or pay for. After arguing, they moved us. Then, cleaning service did not come the next day while we were out of our room between 9:45am and 3:15pm. I called guest services to alert of this - did nothing except bring up fresh towels. Then, cleaning service called us because we had a do not disturb sign on the door after 3:15pm when they wanted to clean. Housekeeping also banged on our door three times the morning of check-out. The hotel charges an arm and leg for each LOCAL phone call, do notice the little sheet of paper near the phone explaining this...something I did not notice. They charge for the Internet - two prices, daily, and charge for the self parking. The bar charged $70 for 5 beers and two, small bottles of water. The in-room convenient prices were equally as expensive. The room was their deluxe king, on the 8th floor facing the bay. Nice view, nice little balcony, which was the only thing we enjoyed - although the weather was unseasonably cold, extremely windy and rainy. The bed was uncomfortable and the furniture looked old and dingy. I did ask for an adjustment on the bill, but guest services would not budge and did not seem to care at all. I also used the spa at the main building. They gave me a key to a locker that didn't work. After fiddling with it for 5 minutes or so, I asked for a new locker and explained the lock was malfunctioning. The staff person said, "yes, a work order has been called in..." I explained she should not have given me that locker then. She didn't seem to care. I was the only person in the spa. So, I have stayed at the Loew's Coronado for the same price and had much better service and rooms. I chose to stay here for a more convenient location. Not worth saving the 10-12 minute drive. Yes, I am particular and have not a problem paying for good service and amenities, however, my experience was definitely poor and worth giving a head's up to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyFaye
Reviews.Content: This hotel actually has two towers. I stayed in the secondary tower (not the main tower with the club lounge, etc). Initially, I was concerned that the secondary tower would be a grave inconvenience. However, the room was quiet, beautifully decorated, extremely spacious, and offered the most beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean. However, to eat in the Club Lounge we had to walk to the primary tower. Fortunately the weather was beautiful and the walk was inviting. The Club Lounge Breakfast was a perfect start of the day. The food was fresh and tasty. Also, the coffee/cappuccino machine is something you must try. The staff were very nice and quite accommodating. This hotel is close to everything in the city, but not in the immediate midst of the hustle and bustle. Also, it is approximately 3 mins from the airport. I could not have asked for a better hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice hotel near the harbor, but staff treat the guests terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Olliebuba
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel near the airport and harbor. Too bad the staff seems to dislike their jobs and transfers their negative attitudes to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvsnorklng
Reviews.Content: We reserved this room on the backside of our vacation to Maui. After a sleepless night at the Hampton Inn, we happened to drive by the Sheraton on the way to the airport early for our flight to Maui. Noticing how very close it is to the airport, we decided to book for our return. Upon arrival, we only had to wait about five minutes for a shuttle to the hotel at around 10pm. Their shuttle operates from 4am until 12 midnight. We were checked in and in our beds by 11 o'clock. We realized that their restaurant didn't open until 6:30 a.m., and we needed to leave for the airport early the next morning. So, we ordered our breakfast by leaving the menu tag hanging on our door to be delivered between 6 and 6:15 a.m. At 5:58 a.m. it was cheerfully delivered hot, and as ordered with a newspaper. We arrived downstairs a few minutes before seven, and were picked up by the airport shuttle within minutes. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom super clean, and room very quiet with a view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: f l
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were there from the 23rd to the 26th of Febuary 2012. We were not satisfied with this hotel because we got there with high expectatives due to the brand name of Sheraton and the price of the room, just with this you would expect a quality and clean room. 1. We arrived to the room we were assigned and it was dirty( it wasn't clean from the last stay of unknowns) 2. They immediately changed us to the room in front. The bathtub was dirty, the sheets were brownish in some part and the bathroom was full of hair( this just one more time gave the impression that the hotel WAS NOT CLEAN. 3. They moved us up to a Suite( which was even smaller than the regular guest room) and what we do recognize is that they gave us free breakfast for both of us for the 3 nights we were there. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. Not such a good location wither because you must have a car to go to the center for dinner, lunch, any other activity you want.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: PJH1968
Reviews.Content: First of all let me start by saying the shuttle from the airport was waiting when we got there. Our luggage was arriving later in which the airlines and hotel took care of. We had a room in the Marina tower on the 8th floor great view (main tower). Employees at the hotel were amazing. Breakfast buffet in the restaurant was great every morning. Boyd the food and beverage manager was not only professional but extremely friendly. Totally makes sense as to why the staff was the same way. Carlos was fantastic and the other servers we had were good also although I can not remember their names. (sigh) The highlight of our trip to this hotel was Doug in the restaurant. AMAZING!!!! Not only was he knowledgable about the places we were going he let us know what we should try and look for. For instance Knott's Berry Farm...he suggested the pie and fried chicken....WOW!!! Was he right. We even brought him a piece of pie back as a thank you. Our children looked forward to their talks with Doug at breakfast. The first day he asked us how smart are kids were and of course like every parent we say they are brilliant. Doug then presented them with a riddle and they answered correctly. He was happy about that. Our kids wrote him a note when we left with a picture of his favorite animal in the zoo an okapi. It is people like that that make trips so memorable. All that to say we had a fantastic stay at the Sheraton Marina San Diego. Thank you Doug and Boyd Young for a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lexi110
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my couple of nights here. I stayed in the Bay Tower which is the smaller hotel approx 10 min walk from the Marina Tower. I was on the 7th floor with a stunning view of the marina from the large balcony. The rooms are very big and nicely decorated (30% bigger than Marina Tower rooms I was told). Bed was super comfortable. I walked through the Marina Tower which is a much bigger hotel. The lobby is more impressive and the bar/restaurant there was more happening, plus there is Starbucks there...the Bay Tower just has a bar/restaurant. I was more than content with the Bay Tower though! I reserved through the Sheraton website and got a ridiculously good deal, $130ish. I paid 4 times that much for one night at a hotel in Santa Monica! Location: it's a bit far from downtown, but if you love to walk, as we do, it's fine, plus you are walking by the water so it's really pretty. A cab to the zoo cost $20 incld tip, cab from the Gaslamp was $15 with tip. Given the great rate it made sense for us to stay a little further out and take the occasional cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Wahoowa97
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference in March for 3 days. The central reservation center made in error in my reservation and did not book the room for the last night of my stay but instead reserved the room for the night of my departure. I discovered this upon my arrival to the hotel. The check-in staff informed me that they were sold of out of rooms for the last night. The hotel manager on duty then said all Starwood hotels were sold out in the area and that it was up to me find my own accommodations! So basically I took it upon myself by calling the Starwood main reservation line and after basically a half hour of being placed on hold and the run around, I was placed in another nearby Sheraton. I was therefore displaced from the hotel where my conference was and had to find my own transportation to the conference. This inconvenience is only magnified due to my overall dissatisfaction with the service (actually lack of) that the hotel staff here provided. To top it off, there is no WiFi in the rooms and to get internet is through an ethernet cable which is $12 per 24 hours and I got overcharged for using the in-room food bar. The rooms themselves are nice. I was in the Bay tower. In-room coffee maker, flat panel TV, The whole complex is huge and there is a free shuttle from the airport to the main Marina tower and between the 2 towers. The airport shuttle runs every 25 minutes which is an eternity when you have just come off a long flight. Basically one person's bad experience..would not recommend or recommend this hotel. Each guests experience is different. Mine just happened to be bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Like Property”
Reviews.Author: ualsdguy
Reviews.Content: This property is beautifully maintained! From the outdoor grounds to the club floor, everything was clean and looked fresh. The hotel is broken up into two buildings. The Marina Tower being the "main" tower with restaurants, pools, gym, tennis courts, Starbucks and club lounge. The Bay Tower is about a 5 minute walk along the marina and while not a huge deal it would be a little inconvenient if you were wanting to be close to the action of the hotel. The property sits on the marina and across the street from the airport, BUT this is not a typical airport hotel !! It is somewhere between hotel and resort property probably partly because of the expansive grounds and being on the marina. The rooms in the Marina tower are a tad on the smaller side, but have balconies and in excellent condition. Rooms in the Bay tower are a bit larger. The higher floors have wonderful views no matter which building you are in or which direction you are facing. Even the lower floors I imagine would have nice views as there is nothing around the immediate property but marina or bay. Full Starbucks in the lobby is very convenient for morning nibbles or whatever coffee concoction you like best. There is also a full service restaurant with a very nice breakfast buffet. Equally enjoying is the club lounge on the top floors which is a wonderful place to relax and watch the sunrise over breakfast or the sunset over appetizers and drinks. The front desk agents we encountered were very friendly and helpful, even when we asked to check in at 9am. Although a room wasn't immediately available, it was shortly thereafter and well before the normal afternoon hotel check in time. The restaurant waiter we had was also very attentive and friendly. And I have to give a big thanks to the club lounge waiter who was equally attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an active family”
Reviews.Author: Kzw2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and never know what kind of room our Hotwire rate will buy so we were THRILLED when the front desk staff accommodated our request for a bay view room on a top floor! Â In the morning we watched dolphins swim casually back and front from our balcony. Â (Note: there are two distinct hotels and we actually prefer the Bayview tower. Â You can choose either a view of the bay or view of the marina from this tower. We've had both and you can't go wrong either way). I loved the way the bed was angled to face the water. Â What a great view from the bed! Â  Right out the side door of the Bayview Tower is a sweet little deli, Papanani's, Â that serves nice cook to order breakfast that you can call ahead and order, take-out back to your room, or eat right on the marina. Highly recommend it. Â  The hotel rent bikes (though we brought our own) and its a lovely little bike ride along the water to downtown. Our kids are 9 and 6 and were thrilled by the ships we passed on our bike ride (pirate ships/aircraft carriers) and we even got to stop and watch a habor seal put on a show for us while it chased a school of circling fish! Â What fun! Â I cannot say enough about the great staff that work here. We forgot our kids' helmets and they were so kind in letting us borrow some for free and even replaced a bolt we'd lost off my bike. Â We biked over to Liberty Park too which is an awesome kids park: Â tons of grass and multiple play areas!!! In the past we have also biked to Balboa Park/zoo from this hotel. Â Did I mention we had awesome service from everyone we encountered which really makes a difference to me. The workout room was very nice! Â We only swam in the Marina Tower pool and it was nice. The hottub was big! The room was nice and big too. Â The only negative was I didn't have hot water for my late morning shower. It was only warm. Overall an excellent stay.Â

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel in February 2012. The rooms were clean, service was excellent, and the staff was helpful and courteous. I enjoyed the decor and feel of being at the harbor. Restaurants at the hotel and in the area were goos, and Harbor Island was a great place to wander and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful San Diego stay at Sheraton Hotel & Marina”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: We loved this place, the staff was very friendly, made you feel special and they gave us an upgrade without having to ask at all. Also included a Welome drink of your choice in the bar! Just a great Welcome experience. Our room overlooked the Bay and it was quite spectacular both by day and night. The hotel offers a nice fitness center and swimming pool areas with Hot tub. Our room was very comfortable, plenty of room to relax. All in all I would love to stay again and hopefully will. Great getaway weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sheraton Airport Property-stay without hesitations”
Reviews.Author: DougDilvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for one night with my wife and two small kids. We booked connecting rooms and paid for the upgrade to the Club Level Floor. Airport Shuttle was waiting for us, with a very helpful and pleasant driver. Shuttle runs to and from airport every 15 minutes. Check in was flawless, quick and painless. Our club level connecting rooms in the Marina tower were great for our family. Typical Sheraton rooms and exactly what we expected. One bonus are that the rooms come with a balcony. Our rooms overlooked the Marina and we really enjoyed looking at the boats and people watching from the balcony. We used the main pool just below the restaurant. It wasn't too warm that day outside (60 ish) so actually my kids used the pool while we sat and watched. We ordered room service delivered to the pool deck and it arrived quickly and was quite tasty. As mentioned in other rooms, food and beverage are pretty expensive, and there are not any other options within walking distance, so plan ahead. The upgrade to the club floor was worth it for the appetizers in the evening and the nice breakfast spread in the morning. Only downer is that this Club level does not offer complementary adult beverages, but rather a cash bar. I was hoping the cash bar prices would be a bit less than the regular bar, but they were still on the expensive side. With that being said the staff working in the Club Lounge were great. We enjoyed our time in the lounge. Took a cab into San Diego proper for a few hours....15 bucks each way, so reasonable if you are not wanting to rent a car. I would highly recommend this airport property if you have a lay over or early flight. It was a great station for us to stay at for the night. One other note, we were not bothered by airport noise, but our room faced the Marina and not the airport. Stay here without hesitations. This is a nice property with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jnlduck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and we loved the view of the marina. The outdoor fire pits are relaxing to sit by. The only downfall is that the parking lot was usually full, so we had to walk a little distance. They did let us check in 3 hours early. The location near the airport is nice and the planes didn't bother us. The beds were comfortable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely clean. The entire staff was polite and courteous. Our room had lots of chrome fixtures and there wasn't one fingerprint or smudge anywhere. The view of the bay was great. We usually stay at the Radisson for the sleepnumber beds, but this was better than I thought it would be and the bed was very comfortable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cute room, GREAT view.”
Reviews.Author: GetOutAndLive
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews on this site but I have to say our one night stay was FANTASTIC! Our room was facing the marina and the sunset on the patio was BREATHTAKING. Our room was 2 queen beds and left very little room for extra bags or stretching room but we made do. The room itself was very clean and had very nice furnishings. Some have mentioned the proximity to the airport, the only time I noticed this was when I was in the hot tub and I could hear planes fly over, when I was in my room I never would have known I was near it. The grounds a beautiful and the staff was very attentive, they even let us check in 3 hours early. The one thing I would like to mention is Nicholas in lost and found. He saved me BIG TIME. I am from Alaska and I somehow left my big winter parka in my room. I had a flight out the next day and called frantically to the hotel, even though it was after hours Sue transferred me to his extension telling me to leave a message and she would contact him directly letting him know I needed assistance ASAP. Sure enough within minutes of leaving a message I received a call back. They had my coat and would be able to FedEx it to me in the morning. He went above and beyond standard customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Kathyblair
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here on our anniversary in may 2011. I live on the east coast and I was amazed to what we experienced. I loved our room, the staff was out of this world, and the best part was the airport was right across the street. I would most definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the Sheraton it didn't help that I had to wait 20 minutes. I was asked at check in if I would be a "green" patron. I asked what that meant and it was that housekeeping would not change out my towels and that they would leave me a voucher for the restaurant / bar for $5. I stayed 4 nights and what it meant was that housekeeping didn't come at all to empty the trash or make the bed. Also, these $5 vouchers could not be combines to go towards an overall meal, making you either use them for drinks at the bar. On top of that I was slapped with a $22 / night charge for self parking (most likely because of the marina). Outside of these comments, the hotel was nice and clean and the service was okay. If you don't have a car, it's a reasonable place to stay, otherwise, I'd suggest that you find another hotel in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for me”
Reviews.Author: jeppa3579
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a conference at the convention center and stayed at this hotel for four nights through hotwire. As a huge fan of public transportation and walking, I tried to walk. It is 3 miles one way and it ook me a full one hour, so I stopped doing this after a day. You can hop in the free airport shuttle and take mts992, which costs only $2.25 and just a few minutes to downtown, although you need to walk additional few blocks to the convention center. Upon the recommendation from this site, I requested a room with a downtown view, and the staff gave me a room at Bay Tower (about 1000 ft from Marina Tower). I found out that I could not see the downtown. The next day, I requested a room to Marina Tower to be near the airport shuttle without any preference to the view, and I was given a room with a beautiful downtown view. From the experience of staying at both towers, the room at Marina Tower was smaller and was okay since I was alone, and I presume that even numbered room at Marina Tower: harbor/airport view odd numbered room at Marina Tower: downtown view even numbered room at Bay Tower: airport view odd numbered room at Bay Tower: harbor view. The staff were very nice. I did not have the privilege of using free wifi in the room, but I saw people with status get it. There are a few computers in the lobby and the connectivity was good. I have no particular complaint against the hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jlyn1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location but the hotel and rooms need to be updated. The rooms have some wear that is visible but the rooms are comfortable. I have stayed there twice and found some staff to be very helpful and others not so much. I would recommend the hotel as long as you go on Priceline or Hotwire and get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Facility”
Reviews.Author: rinaic
Reviews.Content: Positives: -Airport Access -Marina Location -Lobby Free Internet Access -Balconies on rooms with chairs -Comfortable bed Negatives: -Run down room -Run down airport shuttle -Expensive (overpriced) on-site dining I got a really good rate at this facility, but upon check-in and seeing my room I quickly checked availability at other options. Seeing as how I was only destined to sleep a few hours over two nights at this hotel, I elected to stay. The rooms were outdated, especially the bathroom. Lights above the mirror were about 5'8" high, which wasn't conducive to a slightly taller person who has to shave. Fixtures were rusty, shower curtain was too long (about 4" on the bath floor, inside the bath), and the sink was once-overed with crud collecting against the wall below the mirror. It was pretty much unacceptable and if I had arrived at a decent time or normal state of mind I would have definitely requested a room change. The on-site dining charged resort rates for food, which I feel based on the overall condition of things is overpriced. I did not order any of the food. At one time this may have been a 4 star facility, I would now rate it a 3 star facility operating at about 2.5 stars overall. The staff was overall friendly and helpful, although upon arrival it was like pulling teeth to ask for a king instead of the two twins they had me booked in. He tried not to change me, but in a courteous and professional manner. I would not stay at this hotel again, however I think it is a fair value at a 3 star rate for a big hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as they could be.”
Reviews.Author: DUpton
Reviews.Content: I reserved and paid in advance for a room with a King bed, but was given a room with two doubles or queens. I reported this to the front desk and was told there were no King rooms left. This always confuses me. If I reserve it and PAY for it, why don't I get it. As I was only in for one night, I let it go. The room itself was good sized and the bathroom was clean. The hotel is not as close to things as the website suggests, or at least they take longer than you would assume by the given distances posted. Nothing is within walking distance. The parking is pretty expensive at $22/ day self, $30/ valet. If you self park, be ready for a hike back to the lobby. The price per night at $119 was reasonable for the room, but there are additional taxes and parking fees that took my final bill to over $155. If you are there for an overnight stay between flights and don't have a car and plan to stay in, the hotel is in a good spot. If you plan to visit downtown or the Gaslamp area, bring plenty of cash as a taxi will run $30-$50 round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good marina location”
Reviews.Author: Californian1
Reviews.Content: I am ambivalent about this hotel, mainly because of the service. Aside from the pleasant gym attendant and waitstaff in the restaurants, the other employees were less effective than automated voice response units. They did get their jobs done, but offered nothing without prompting. Otherwise I enjoyed the marina location. It's a nice area for walking and the pool was great. The marina tower room was fine. The club breakfast had a good selection of items. This is a good option if you're arriving on a late flight and just want to jump on a quick shuttle to your room. By the way, I didn't hear a single plane during my stay. A helicopter once while outside, but otherwise no excess noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, even when they were challenged by the San Diego blackout.”
Reviews.Author: hhclemrn
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good about the Sheraton Marina Bay in San Diego. We were there for the graduation of my son from USMC boot camp, and the lights went out all over the entire city that afternoon. Literally, no one had power. We were there with our younger children, and I had so many concerns over where we would feed them, if we would even be able to check into the hotel, etc. The temperature that day was around 100 degrees. Well, we got to the Sheraton, and the line to check in was long because they only had 2 computers working off generators and all these people were trying to check in whose flights had been cancelled (it's right by the airport). The staff were walking around handing out water bottles to all of us and light sticks because there was no power in the rooms. The cold water was such a blessing and I just thought the light sticks were such a nice thing to do. Then, if you can believe it, they had a cold buffet set up in the dining area that evening that had cold cuts, cheeses, pasta salad, green salad, etc. I was so relieved to know my kids would get to eat! They had very few lights on, but the servers were friendly despite the circumstances they were working in, and the presentation offered was amazing considering they only had a short time to put this together and make sure their guests could have something to eat. I felt taken care of. Really. Of course the rooms had no lights, but it was clean and comfortable. The sun had gone down and we had a nice breeze from the bay through our balcony's sliding glass door, so it actually was cool in our room by the time we went to bed. The power came back on around midnight thankfully. In summary, as a mom being away from home in a city I didn't know with no power, with my young children, I can't say enough about how well taken care of I felt by the Sheraton. I felt safe and was just so pleased with how gracious all the staff was under such duress themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Mr. Casanova and Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: JeffB30196
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at the Sheraton Marina in San Diego for a conference. Pleasant place to stay. Good conference facilities. Nice amenities, place to walk. But what really left me feeling good about the place is this: In a hurry to catch my plane after the conference, I left behind a dresser drawer full of clothing. Because of my schedule, it was more than a week before I realized where I had left it. When I called, Mr. Nicolas Casanova from Lost & Found tracked my clothes down for me and returned them to me intact. Way to go Sheraton. I won't forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey P
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in the other tower over looking the Bay...beautiful view from our balcony each morning with the dolphin and sea lions playing. Fun to enjoy the coll morning temps with coffee in hand. The staff is friendly and the rooms are large and clean...always a bonus for us traveling with 2 teens! This hotel location is perfect! Close to lots of restaurants, downtown etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessLady78
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very spacious and clean. This staff was very courteous and had a complimentary hotel shuttle. Several trolleys, etc. pick up from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Leah K
Reviews.Content: Each staff member I encountered at the Sheraton was extremely friendly and helpful. The shuttle drivers, front desk folks, maintenance staff and bartenders were all welcoming and offered advice about the hotel and community. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the food was great. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ilovevacationkk
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much since it was a hotel near the airport, but the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina is a great place to stay! The hotel is beautiful--has a nice pool, jacuzzi, and fire pits right by the harbor. The views from the room were nice as well. The room was clean and stylish. We could hear the airplanes taking off every once in a while from the airport, but it didn't bother me a bit (and I'm an extremely light sleeper). Upon our arrival, the valet were very helpful and answered our questions about where to park. Susanna from In Room Dinning was so nice when she brought our breakfast up the next morning! (The front desk had forgotten to give us our F&B discount card upon arrival and she said no problem she would take care of it and she made sure the bill was adjusted). The concierge (can't remember her name, but she had brown hair) was really helpful as well and printed off directions to five different places for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is a dream!”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler2121
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more impressed with the Sheraton Hotel & Marina. The location-very near-the airport-is wonderful..right on the water and convenient to everything. The staff goes out of their way for their guests, the rooms are beautiful and there is great food and service at Tapatinis--just off the lobby. After a slight mix-up with my room, the GM called to make sure everything was taken care of. I travel to San Diego often and will not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Recent conference stay unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference there recently. The conference was in the main tower, even though I had a reservation there, I was put in the Bay tower (an old Westin) that is located at a separate location. I am not sure how far it is, but it was a very long way back and forth in the rain. I ended up spending almost 3 hours waiting for the shuttle (supposed to be every 20 minutes) during the 2 days. One evening it was raining and i waited for 40 minutes. No wireless internet in the room. It did have wired that i didn't use. One hour limited wireless in the lobby. My spouse tried to eat there one evening and couldn't even get anyone to seat her. If you have to be there for a conference -think twice about accepting a Bay tower room. You are somewhat isolated at this property. Not much close by. I would not stay there for a vacation without a vehicle. The main hotel looked nice when i walked through the lobby to attend meetings. The food at our conference was average. One evening we had a dinner for 250. The food was cold. Not warm, cold.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: JohnR92656
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Feb 17th & 18th to party with some friends at the Gaslamp Area of San Diego. The hotel was very nice, not sure if its a four star but it definately felt like a four star! Got my room for $129!! GREAT RATE and great location, only about 5 miles from Gaslamp area! Parking was $22, not bad! I would definately stay there again when I'm in San Diego! P.S. The rooms and hotel were IMMACULATE! VERY CLEAN and very NEW LOOKING!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: sdonnac40601
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina 2/14 - 2/17 and had a very nice stay. Comfortable room, pleasant staff, good food at Quinns and a beautiful view of the marina and harbor. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of harbor, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: funtravel4466
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view and experience of the San Diego harbor. Hotel accommodations were very good. Rooms were well appointed, very clean and tastefully decorated. All the employees we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. Had an issue with the heating in the room but maintenance came quickly and fixed the problem. Were disappointed that the suite we had reserved was not the room that was given to us. Since we were there for a week, a separate living/bedroom area would have served our needs better. Lunch in the bar was very good - had the marinated skirt steak sandwich. Room was exceptionally quiet for the entire week until the last night when people above us created a lot of noise, stomping, jumping, etc. Bed linens were luxurious, however the mattress was so extremely soft that we had backaches all week. No support at all. Spa experience (facial) was very enjoyable. Ask for Mary Ann. She was great.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: desimd
Reviews.Content: I visit every year for a conference. The experience is almost always excellent. This time was no different. The rooms are sparkling clean and well-stocked. The restaurant and bar are lively and serve great food. Their meeting facilities are outstanding. The proximity to the airport makes this a very convenient hotel. The distance from the city center means you always have to cab it there rather than take a leisurely stroll.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location to receive a "bay" experience. Average rooms. However, beautiful views. A special thanks to Anthony in the Club Lounge for his professionalism and genuine service to me and my conference mates during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Location”
Reviews.Author: L L
Reviews.Content: There's many things I like about this property. There are a few negatives. Positives First: - Love the location, close to airport but with a harbor/bay view - My room (on 12 floor) had a balcony facing the water which was very nice. - Club lounge on the 13 or 14 floor is very decent. The evening snacks are great and tasty. Examples include fried chicken. The breakfast spread is adequate. Bagels, eggs, oatmeal, fruits, small selection of ham and cheese, juices, tea/coffee. No hot breakfast. The views are phenomenal. The sitting is comfy. - The rooms facing the bay (ie. with the view are great) - Its a very short drive to the Gas Lamp Quarter; maybe 7 minutes or less. Its literally two minutes to the airport. - Rooms are not luxurious but very comfortable. Decor is reasonable, in blue. Negatives - the hotel does not have good restaurants. The restaurants share one kitchen, and depending on your luck, the wait and service for food can range from 5 to 25 minutes. Its a big drawback. Having said that, the service, when you do get it, is reasonable. The waitstaff try very hard to please. The fitness center is reasonable with a wide range of equipment. There are decent pools, but I didn't get to use them. All in all, I would stay again, as long as I am not counting to eat at their restaurants. There is a starbucks at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Sheraton is in fact two hotels, the Sheraton and Bay Towers some 600 yards around the corner. Similar to previous reviewer, after having parked my car and gone to reception, I had to drive around to the Bay Hotel to my room. Hotel is in a great position, close to the airport next to the water. Bars are quiet as was the restaurant. Be warned however, a quick visit to the Gaslamp District will cost you @18 USD one way if you want to party. Otherwise, the Sheraton provides all the usual amenities, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhhk
Reviews.Content: Convenient for the airport, though plane noise is not too noticeable in the guest rooms. Clean room, if in need of renovation (though the check in staff implied it had been recently renovated). Definitely worth staying in the main tower. If you want more than a standard airport hotel, this is not for you. The restaurant was the disappointment. The staff wearing badly coffee stained shirts, the food average, with little attention to detail (e.g. The soup comes with biscuits still in plastic packets) yet relatively high priced. Few alternative options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport, but won't select for a stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: ServiceMatters86
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not too high. I selected this hotel because it was convenient to the airport. I had stayed at this hotel many years ago for a large conference. I was pleased to have an upgrade into an executive suite as an SPG Platinum member. As is typical of large hotels, it was a long walk to the room. The room was old but had been updated to meet Sheraton standards. The club floor lounge was very large. The food was limited. The staff in the club lounge was very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Is worth it for the view alone”
Reviews.Author: jasminsunnycoast
Reviews.Content: We found a great rate at the Sheraton through priceline and were amazed with the quality for the price we paid! We had a room overlooking the marina and the sunset from the balcony was fantastic after a busy day seeing the sights. Staff were lovely and helpful, rooms were nicely furnished and close to the airport. We had a car so found it easy to drive around from the location. We didnt eat at the resort but enjoyed heading into the Gaslamp District as there was so much on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Two hotels one name”
Reviews.Author: Gordondd9
Reviews.Content: Be sure to enquire which hotel your room is in as I called hotel in advance, was not forewarned by staff, parked car, offloaded luggage, walked from far end of parking lot only to be told I was in Bay Tower...which is essentially another hotel 600 yards or more away. Had the front desk person told me when I called and she knew I was driving over I would have avoided a needless exercise. Hotel fairly basic Sheraton. Saw various people speaking to staff during visit with service issues. Next time will try Hilton which is next to Bay Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlfudge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights during s conference - stayed in the Marina tower. The bed was very comfortable and I had 3 great nights of sleep which is highly unusual for me. I loved the city/bay view and I never closed the drapes . The sunsets and sunrises were amazing. What impressed me the most was the staff. Every single persons greeted me sincerely - from the front desk to the maid on the 11th floor, to the wait staff during the conference luncheon to the guys packing up the conference chairs . The customer service training at this to hotel really shows - but the sincerity was amazing. The employees honestly seem happy to work here - every single one. Room for improvement: better transportation downtown for those of us who didn't bring a car. The city bus stop was way too far away and there wasn't enough info for us to figure how how to get to downtown ourselves. This hotel will feel isolated for those who like to walk to restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted by the "Green" Treatment”
Reviews.Author: AbbyBella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a conference, and while the hotel was pleasant I was unhappy with several features, especially the "green" housekeeping option. When I signed up I understood we were just foregoing having our sheets and towels changed daily, but instead we discovered we received NO housekeeping services whatsoever -- including replenishment of our in-room coffee and shampoo. I also was surprised that despite our reservations far in advance, we were assigned a room literally in the basement. We had a nice little patio with a couple of chairs, but the view was of a wall below the parking lot. The day of our departure I received an email offering me a view for an additional substantial daily charge (which I declined), and then found that other people at the conference enjoyed lovely views at no additional cost. There's also no wi-fi in the rooms -- and hard-wire Internet costs about $12 a day. Finally, access to the hotel is poor without a car. Even the Old Town Trolley comes by only once in the morning and once in the evening. There must be better deals in San Diego, and if I were not attending a conference there I'd certainly find them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, space, value & service”
Reviews.Author: bseagram
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights pre-cruise with a group of 70 at this hotel. Whole group thrilled with hotel. Service in restaurant superb. Ronnie Hophman (Food & Beverage Manager) was very professional and helpful. Brian, waiter, went out of his way to be cheerful and went teh extra mile to do things for us. Alex, another waiter, leaped out of nowhere to help when my husband choked (badly) on his coffee. He was fabulous. Front desk staff very good. Rooms spacious and lovely. Beds VERY comfortabel. I slept 10 hrs!!! Turn right out of hotel, go to water. Turn left and walk a ways. YOu will come to Island Prime, a restaurant that has Happy Hour prices and $5.00 appetizers (REALLY good) 3.30-5.30 pm. A lovely walk along the water. San Diego is lovely. Must go to zoo also. Cheers Barbara Seagram

Reviews.Title: “rather good hotel but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Marusya757
Reviews.Content: rinStayed there 4 nights and wanted to combine business and pleasure. Asked the receptionist to put me in the room with better water view and she did the opposite - I had to drive 7 minutes to Bay Tower and got the room with view on PARKING and road (and the bay is somewhere far!) Next morning I had to move to Marina Tower. That's first time I see the hotel where You need to DRIVE between towers . Parking is open air but cost 22USD (self). Marina Tower (Main) was rather good, they have nice restaurant and free internet in the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the water”
Reviews.Author: Kmac81
Reviews.Content: So close to the airport without the feel of an "airport hotel". Stayed in the Marina tower and loved the nautical decor. Walk along the harbor right outside and in fact spotted dolphins swimming in the harbor on our walk over to the Starbucks in the Harbor tower. Pool at the Marina tower was small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location Worked for Us. $22 Parking.”
Reviews.Author: NormanIL
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel in late Jan. I was very concerned about the location prior to arrival due to the proximity to the airport, however, it turned out to be a great location for us. Rent a car and you will be central to everything San Diego has to offer. Going down town to eat got old quickly due to traffic and crowds and we found ourselves spending more and more time in the Point Loma, an area just north of the hotel. The whirlpool was very nice and big, 10 people can comfortably fit. The room was nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. It's not a Westin heavenly bed but it is far from the low end. There is airport noise but it's mostly during the day when we were away so it's not an issue. Our room was overlooking the marina (away from the airport) so the other side might be different. $22/day parking is very high and you have no viable alternative. It was interesting that long term airport parking in the area was $10/day. My one complaint is the price of parking. Seems very excessive and should be included in room rates. Internet was only free in the lobby. The 4 lobby computers were in good condition and provided fast access. We checked weather and "sites to see" in the lobby prior to leaving for the day. Overall we had a great stay and would consider this hotel if returned to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stays or if you have a rental car”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton near SAN provides a nice play to rest for short trips in the area. While there are not many restaurants/services in the surrounding vicinity, the hotel provides several options including a gift shop and two restaurants with overpriced, but decent food. The breakfast buffet - while limited in choices - had a nice sampling of fresh fruit. We enjoyed playing ping-pong in the recreation area and found the pool and hot tub to be a perfect end to the day. We also loved our time by the fire pit, finding it especially satisfying after a dip. The room itself was nicely appointed and very comfortable. Service was excellent and the free shuttle bus to the airport prompt and convenient. Stay here for short trips and when you need a good base for jumping off into the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place ever”
Reviews.Author: jakki o
Reviews.Content: Spectacular views of the bay, great big room with plenty of space to relax and chill. loved sitting on the balcony looking at the ships go by within feet of the hotel! Marina hotel very luxerious with outstanding breakfast. Service very friendly and extremley attentive. Free internet with easy accessibility to it. Parking fees a little expensive but its worth it to have a car. Literally minutes from the airport which sounds daunting and looks daunting but is well placed and not noisy at all, not sure how they do it! Spent 5 fab days there and loved every minute! will definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ikaika B
Reviews.Content: great service, great view....great stay. Big thank you to "lost and found department" for finding and shipping my things fast and safely. When I go to san diego that's my place to stay. Thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, very clean, courteous staff, excellente food, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Juana Ines N
Reviews.Content: I had a great time. staff were very courteous and helpful, food was excellent, big space and view. Nice room with a beautiful view. Free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: phishinau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while on a trip out west. Fantastic location,and amazing views of the harbor and of the Naval base across the way. Durning the afternoons you could see the helicopters performing manuvers and all kinds of fun stuff. It's a short cab ride into the city, we always hit the Gaslamp when we go and this time we caught a Padres game too. If you have a little bit of time also check out Old Town for some amazing food and drinks and then head over to Coronado to check out the hotel and go to McP's pub for a few drinks. McP's is incredible, SEAL and miltiary memorabilia all over the place, as this is a favorite hangout of the locals from the base we're told.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here for a convention. We took the complimentary shuttle from the airport & they set a great first impression for the hotel; very friendly, gave us lots of tips on where to visit while we were in town. Smooth, friendly check in. They have a bar & grill type place, restaurant & a Starbucks. I took advantage of them all but would stay stick to drinks at the bar. The food was low quality, like a mom was back there showing her 8 year old how to cook. Clean, spacious rooms, really comfy bed & pillows - but request a higher floor. We were in what I would call the basment - it was the floor below the entrance. Balconies in all rooms & that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel. Very clean, great view, very courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with a very friendly staff of people. They act as if they appreciate you staying at their facility. Be aware of the food and drink in the refrig it could become costly. Very nice room with a beautiful view. Free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Why I look forward to coming back”
Reviews.Author: Vic V
Reviews.Content: I am in this hotel every month for three days since December. I usually dread the idea of staying in a hotel and don't sleep well. However, my experience here has been far above anywhere I have stayed and I look forward to each stay. I actually sleep well and enjoy my room, and truly enjoy the views from my window! The staff are great, and the food is really good. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dorwin_10
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have chosen the Sheriton San Diego, both experiences were excellernt, every comfort one could need plus a great view from the balcony. Staff were efficient and very friendly. Restaurant was comfortable and tables not crowded together, my only criticism is that the food is quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Close to The Airport”
Reviews.Author: Mugimo
Reviews.Content: The facilities are fantastic and the service was excellent! The valet parking was extremely fast and on time. The rooms are great and the view is beautiful. The location is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the water”
Reviews.Author: luvncancun
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the price. We chose the Bay tower over the Marina tower because the rooms are 33% bigger. Great Views and the rooms have balconies which our family loves.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Marjact
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks it is trying to be a luxury hotel but the towels were small and not very thick. As others have said, you must take a cab everywhere. It is the hotel Holland America uses but I'm not sure why when there is a Holiday Inn half a block from the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, dirty and cold room”
Reviews.Author: Dawn N
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night because we were visiting Sea World the next day. It is very close to Sea World and close to lots of fun areas and the view is wonderful. The room itself needed a little bit of TLC. There was lipstick on the window because someone had kissed it and there was mold in the shower grout. There was also hair on the floor. It didn't have a central heating system- only a wall unit and the wall unit was filthy and didn't work very well. We called the front desk and they didn't seem too concerned with fixing it. We waited 30 mins for someone to show up and eventually just gave up and went to bed. In the middle of the night the smoke detector started beeping because the battery was low. So that was fun too. :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Sheraton I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: mike g
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Sheraton's in the U.S. and this one is tops in my opinion. Nicely located on the marina with great views. Close to the airport so perfect for business travelers. A bit of noise from the airplanes depending on where you are located within the hotel but that is expected. Upgraded always as a Platinum member which is really nice. Main restaurant is very nice. Sports bar is good for a casual dinner and to catch the game.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: scoutsterkc
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD Customer service at the Bay Tower was fantastic; we arrived a few hours before scheduled check-in but were allowed to check-in early. Front desk staff was very nice and accommodating. Harbor view was beautiful and the room was clean and comfortable with a nautical theme. The bathroom was a bit disappointingâ€”it looked tired like a bathroom from a 1980s family home. Still, it was manageable and everything worked fine. THE NOT-SO-GOOD Only two major complaints about the Bay Tower: the location and the noise. I booked on Priceline thinking it would be closer to Gaslamp; *technically* we could have walked there, but it would have been quite a hike. Since we didn't have a rental car (and didn't want to pay for a taxi), our exploration radius was very limited. And since we were in our room much of the time, we noticed that it was quite noisy. You could hear every sound from the hallway from quiet conversations to people dragging in from the clubs at 2-3am. And since we were there over New Year's Eve, we also heard several boisterous groups until around 4am. Unrelated: could not access free wi-fi. Decent stay overall, but probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is an airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galavant10
Reviews.Content: Please don't get me wrong, but this airport Hotel is just that. Simply put, it is a good choice if you are having to spend the night before catching a flight or arriving a day before a cruise and nedd a place to stay overnight. There are much better choices for spending longer in San Diego,, especially if you don't want to have to rent a car. It is located near San Diego Airport but just a bit too far from the Gas Lamp district to hoof it on foot. This about a caution about location rather than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before an early flight. We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport. For an airport hotel, it does not seem like one at all. The hotel is really beautiful, warm and welcoming. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. We checked in early and received a room upgrade since we are Starwood Gold Members. The suite was spacious, new and comfortable. It had a King bed and a Queen size pull out sofa, plus a full size bar and two balconies facing the marina. The bedding was perfect. The bathroom and room were updated. The pool was heated and the jacuzzi was nice. The restaurant has good food and not too pricey. We ended up taking a later flight and we had complementary late check-out at 4:00pm because we are Starwood gold members. There is also a complementary airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes. Overall, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: momdaughter2008
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay very much and the fitness center worked out beautifully for me. The staff is very helpful and go out of their way to provide what is needed. Would greatly recommend a stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Bay”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Christmas Eve while visiting the Rock church and the Zoo. Just a few minutes drive from the Zoo. I booked the room on a last minute deal and got the room for 1/2 price. This is a fantastic place! We choose a Bay view rm. It had an awesome view of the city and was spectacular at night. Our rm. was also awesome, with a balcony overlooking the Bay and city. We were able to leave the slider open at night. Bath rm. was exceptional and the bed was perfect for a good night sleep. They also provided a coffee maker with starbucks coffee, (not often seen in a hotel rm.) They also have a Starbuck in the lobby,(I didn't have to drive for my morning fix!) The only negitive was the parking lot. Paid $10 per day and had to walk past the paved lot to a gravel lot way to the rear of the building. Sort of what you might expect at a truck stop! I left only because of the loudness of the airport and the smell of jet fuel in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingattorney
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in room 726 in the new tower. Terrific stay. Beautiful terrace overlooking the marina. Very nice room with very clean lines. Great shower. Concierge was very helpful. Housekeeping was top notch. Great hotel on the water and within a half a mile of the airport. The planes can be loud but the sight of them taking off and landing so closely was a fun aspect of our stay. Top notch exercise equipment in 24 hour gym. Self park was $22 a day but easy. We'd very likely stay here again. Nice, large waterfront pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place and Good People”
Reviews.Author: slaandfrances
Reviews.Content: Great views, functional, clean, good pool, nice bed, and great breakfast. Perfect fit for its category and price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but its Restaurants are Crap”
Reviews.Author: mathTeach314
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days for a conference. Beautiful location, albeit it's a bit out of the way. Fabulous pool in the bigger building. I stayed in their smaller (and newly acquired) building and was glad -- the other building was nicer, but it was a lot larger and a LOT louder. The restaurants... are crap. No, that's too nice; disgusting is the right word. And the outragous price just ads insult to injury. I ate in all of them (both buildings) except the fancy one. Even breakfast was gross. How do you mess up breakfast? The in-room coffee was better than the restaurant coffee. WTH? Are they trying to get you to go to their Starbucks instead? Value and rating downgraded because of the restaurants. For the love of food, do NOT eat at their restaurants. Go down the island to C Level; it's prices are better, and the food is worlds beyond better.

Reviews.Title: “Good, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. The room was fine. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephenr67
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel - club room is worthwhile, with the lounge access on the top of the hotel offering great views. Rooms are fresh with a kind of beachy/nautical feel

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER, INTERNET BROKEN, WACKY A/C”
Reviews.Author: zeroone1
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those hotel guests that ever complains about a hotel, and I stay in about 30 nights a year. However, I feel compelled to write about my recent stay at this hotel. I never had an unplesant experience at a hotel ever. It all started the day after I checked in. That morning I had NO hot water. None whatsoever, not even warm or room temperature water, just COLD water. I took a nice cold shower! Then I went to the front desk and I got moved to a new room on the 6th floor. I was staying in the Bay tower. Then the water in the new room was not working either.I was then moved AGAIN to a new room, finally to room 697. Finally I got working hot water. The mechanic said the entire wing of rooms on the 6th floor lost hot water due to the line going into most of the rooms. The first night during my stay I couldn't sleep at all, The A/C in the room kept turning off when the room temperature reached 65. It's hard for me to sleep in complete silence! I need the A/C to stay on! I never experienced a hotel's A/C system that doesn't let the customer keep the thing ON! The next day I had to call a mechanic, and he eventually performed some "super duper" A/C thermostat tricks and found a way to put the system to 60. and it stayed ON and cold, finally! Why this hotel doesn't let guests have this simple ability is beyond me. The fun doesn't stop here, the next night in my stay I couldn't get the internet to work on my computer. I called tech support. The mechanic had to come to my room and replace not just the cable cord, but the modem to! Who knows why, but after they replaced all of the defective equipment I finally got online. However this hotel is special! You get to choose 2 speeds! One is the regular speed at like $11, and other is an absurd price of $20 (high speed). I opted for the regular speed and took a chance. BIG MISTAKE! The speed has been the slowest speed of ANY hotel I have every stayed at! It was slow, almost like dialup internet access slow. It was probably like DSL or slower. It was sad. It was so sloooow I got so frustrated I turned my Android phone into a mobile hotspot, and guess what my Tmobile data speed was much faster than the hotel's internet speed, This hotel needs just to offer one speed, and get rid of their slow speed. However with all of the negative experiences I had at this place there were some positives to note: PLUSES: Room services, it was pretty tasty and I enjoyed the shrimp cocktail, and spicy buffalo wings. However, the chicken tenders tasted like cardboard, it was horrible. View: it's gorgeous. I felt so relaxed and peaceful here. And I enjoyed watching the christmas boat light parade as well. Room itself and bed: the bed was pretty comfy, and the room was appointed nice. I used the mini bar a lot, and thought it was convinient even though it is pricey. Anyways I am rating my stay only 2 stars because the negatives of my experience far outweighted the positives. I hope this hotel fixed their hot water issues, and also please fix your ridicolous internet speeds and only offer 1 speed. And let guests FULLY control their A/C. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Marina Tower is the way to go, everything about this location is great with one one exception. I refuse to pay $14.95 for wireless access on principal alone. Location was clean, close to the airport, noise was not an issue. Rooms were spacious and well appointed. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jasonpo
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was clean, the staff were accomodating and pleasant and the views were great. The noise from the Airport was a bit loud at times, but manageable. The parking fees and WIFI charges were a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews.... Good business/meeting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curvy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Sheraton Marina hotel on business as I had to attend some global company meetings there so I did not have much choice on the location however I did want to make sure I had the right room (following the reviews of this site). I can confirm that I stayed in the Marina Tower (which is the main hotel where the Spa and Starbucks are) on the 11th floor in a delux room and it was perfect for one. The room was a little on the small side but I had a kingbed and the room was well equiped with all the normal extras including a Starbuck coffee machine. Check in was efficient (unfortunately check out was slow with what appeared to be a trainee...). Used the spa a couple of times (early in the morning) and had massages with Gary who was great! Meeting room facilities were good and the catering for the meeting was above average. Overall a great business hotel (apart from lack of wifi in the room...)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton plus”
Reviews.Author: Aussies2011
Reviews.Content: The check in was lovely. Arriving by the airport shuttle was a fantastic surprise (we had not asked at the time of booking - while at the airport we seen the 'sheraton' labelled shuttle free YES) lovely. The hotel lobby was so nice and open and fresh. The lady at the desk was wonderful. Really polite, and offered tips on our stay - what we were doing and went out of her way to help us with our check in. When I asked about allergies and restaurants, this lady went out of her way to provide us with the most accurate answer possible. Further since we were on our anniversary, and booking in early (which was some 5 hours earlier due to an earlier flight than expected) this lady checked and re-checked to give us a lovely king bed room (not queen) :)- it was appreciated. The staff overall were fantastic - the layout of the hotel was lovely. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel by the airport with easy access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: willbw02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in dec. Upgraded to room 1223 as a platinum member. Marina suite which is large and clean. The view of the city across the marina is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Faconner
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, five minutes from the airport, with clean, large and comfortable rooms. The location is between the marinas and the bay with great views from every room. A group of three guys stayed there for the weekend that the America's Cup 45's were racing in San Diego bay. They were very accommodating and gave us a room on the eighth floor, overlooking the bay so we could watch the races from the balcony. There was plenty of room for the rollaway bed they provided free of charge. We had breakfast in the very nice restaurant down stairs, and while it was $20, the food and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, views, conference facilities, rooms, restaurants ...”
Reviews.Author: Fishrung
Reviews.Content: .. are all excellent. A small nit - I was disappointed that they still have no WiFi in guest rooms. The wire connection was OK but restrictive. Despite that limitation, I'd recommend the hotel to business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the airport, great service”
Reviews.Author: shortstakk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Bay Tower of this Sheraton over the week of Thanksgiving in 2011. The hotel is nice, has a lot of space, and is quiet. The rooms are basic but nice, including a couch and coffee table area to sit (Tip: The Bay Tower has larger rooms than those in the Marina Tower, which don't have the couch and extra space). The bathrooms need some updating: there's no fan and the sundries are generic. The views overlooking the marina are nice. The hotel is very close to the airport and is convenient for that reason. The service at the hotel was great. Anything we needed they brought immediately and were very accomodating. They unfortunately do not have cribs available if you're travelling with an infant, as we were, but that's a specific need. Overall, not a luxury hotel, but an affordable and decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: shidan a
Reviews.Content: I left the hotel in a hurry and forgot to empty of the drawers. So I called the hotel and they connected me to the Lost and Found department. Nicolas who works in that department was very pleasant and helpful and arranged for my stuff to be delivered to my home 2 days later. I had to pay for the delivery but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monaco-Keller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina twice this year and we loved it both times. The hotel is wonderful. The people are great. The pool, rest., Starbucks, room service, view and price are great. Easy access to the San Diego Airport and close to the freeways and Little Italy and downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - strategic location near airport”
Reviews.Author: Spartyhomer
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Comfortable beds and decent furnishings. Strategically located near San Diego airport. Nice fitness center and workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “Business or Pleasure it IS a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Jaime A
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, Great Housekeeping and Bell Staff, Nice Club Lounge

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexandChristine
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room for 4 nights before catching a cruise home to Australia. I was very pleasantly surprised after reading various reviews. Views were superb and the hotel is angled so that great views of both the bay and the marina are available from various places on each floor. Good phot ops. Staff were very cooperative. I booked through expedia so got free internet and club access but we had trouble getting our key to access the club floor from the lift. It was all sorted out with the utmost courtesy. Room was clean, well equipped etc. No wifi in the rooms. Internet was wired which was a bother for my friend and her ipad. I'd certainly recommend paying for the club level. Breakfast was good and the evening crudites, dips, cheeses and hot dish meant we could have a big lunch and not pay for an evening meal. If you factor this in, the US$30 a day for valet parking is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Got married here, they gave us a free room, called it a "suite"”
Reviews.Author: garek007
Reviews.Content: So there is nothing really WRONG with the individual pieces of this hotel at a glance.... The premises are nice, the rooms are clean, it's close to the airport. BUT, when you start adding it all up and looking at it as a total package, that's when the criticism comes in... I married my wife here in August 2011. Overall, I was very happy with their wedding packages. For only 105$ per person we got a great buffet dinner, 4 HOURS OF OPEN BAR (yay!) and someone who somewhat was a wedding coordinator. I really have no complaints about the wedding stuff. Everything went great, the staff were very helpfule with the setup. The only thing is that some stuff went missing, but that could have been our guests for all I know. Or an honest mistake, and could have gotten thrown away. The room they threw in was really two adjoining rooms and they just opened the door. Hardly a suite by any definition. They were nice rooms, but not a suite. If you get married here, make sure to dicuss that. The nice thing is that we ended up with a view of the bay. Either side of the hotel is not bad, pretty much all the views are good. Also, they charge for parking. If you are the bride and groom, you can get comped, but they will charge all of your guests, and parking is not cheap. If you get married here, they have some pretty good opportunities for photos. We took ours with the San Diego skyline in the background. If you are NOT getting married here then this hotel is ok if you are on business and have a car. Like I said, rooms are clean, etc, but there is not a coffee shop nearby, or a breakfast place, and room service is expensive. If you are in SD to have a good time, I'd suggest staying in Little Italy or the Gaslamp. The Gaslamp will be noisier, but is closer to fun bars/clubs. Little Italy is also fun, but a bit quieter, better for a family. This hotel is 3-5 miles from the Gaslamp and harbor tours, not great if you are here trying to see stuff. But if your goal is to be close to the airport, and you have no desire to leave the room, this hotel might be right for you. Even though room service is expensive, they have alternate options for dining close by. There are some restaurants on harbor island that are withing half mile to a mile away. Email me with questions, I know lots about this stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rache04Connecticut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as starwood members for five nights seeking romance, great location, and a beautiful hotel.
