Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel during a mojor power outage and cannot believe how quickly they had everything together that they could do to make it as easy as possible to check in. They did little things such as having bottles water for the guests standing in line to check in and set up a dinner buffet so people could eat during the outage. Staff also handed out glow sticks as the rooms were dark. I would suggest you give them a try as just a wonderful staff and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not of Sheraton Quality, beware there are two towers!”
Reviews.Author: LaoBlue
Reviews.Content: The Bay Tower is the pits. First, it suffers from the Holiday Inn look. If you book with your SPG points, you will get placed in the cheaper Bay Tower, unless you complain. Rooms suffer from echos from the parking lot (design flaw - big time!). The Bay Tower also has rooms that overlook the bayside, but the road noise is loud, and every voice or music echos up to the balcony and into your room! Lacks minimal things like toothbrushes, robes, and slippers (not like other Sheratons I stayed at!). No refrig - unless you ask? Coffee maker did not work, minimal tea selection - cheap, cheap. Loud lobby area which looks cheap as well. I don't think they offer any upgrades for Gold/Platinum members since it appears all the rooms are the same. It's not worth the 10 K points, maybe 7k at most. The Marina Tower maybe better - well, at least looks better from the lobby/drive up area! If you are paying "big bucks", I would recommend looking elsewhere, but don't stay in the Bay tower!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandraw7
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego after a 14hr Journey from the UK. We caught the complimentary shuttle bus provided by the Sheraton to the Marina Tower, we checked -in and was offered a choice of rooms. We took a room over looking the Harbour in the Lanai rooms. They had two queen beds, desk/work area, coffee maker with a good selection of coffees and teas.These rooms had plenty of space for a family of four 3ads 1 teenager. The balcony was great to watch the sunset in the evening and to watch the harbour. The room was immaculate, sparkling clean bathroom. This hotel had a Starbucks on site, there was a outdoor restaurant Shorelines this was amazing the portions were huge. There was the Harbour Edge restaurant which was open from breakfast til late,Martini Tapas bar, then there was the sports bar Quinn's where you could order food til late and a gift shop.Fitness centre, Spa room fee applied to that, the pool areas were excellent two pools/hot tubs. tennis courts, bike rentals, boat rentals.They had kids activities and on Friday and Saturday they had a Dive in Movie which was a good idea you could swim whilst you watched the movie or just relax on a lounger with a drink and a snack. We opted for the Help the Environment this was a good idea you got $5 voucher for everyday you stayed, if you didn't want all your bath towels and sheets changing every day they came in and just made your bed and refilled the mini bar and your complimentary coffee and teas. We used the vouchers towards eating in Shoreline. The location wasn't a problem I had heard and read from others it was out of the way. Yes it's a little out of the way but it is a nice walk along the front towards Downtown (Little Italy, Gaslamp Quarter, Seaport Village) we took the walk at a leisurely pace and it took just over 1/2hr. We didn't hire a car for our 5day visit and to be honest it's not necessary unless you want to visit the beaches near La Jolla and Oceanside. I would recommend the 2day old town trolley tour this helps with finding out about the area and where you want to spend your time exploring in more depth. We did get a taxi back to the hotel this cost $12 with tip and we also took the MTS public transport this was brilliant we took the hotel shuttle bus back to the airport and boarded the 992 bus to Broadway and we took the no 7 bus to the zoo it took just over 40mins and it was $5 for all day per person you can't get better than that. I think rather than pay $22 per day parking at the hotel and whatever the cost to hire your car using the local transport is good. Ralphs grocery store was good to get a few provisions for the day out at the zoo. This was near Market St in Gaslamp area. The history of the Gaslamp area was fascinating,especially if your into Wyatt Earp etc and around the 1800's, the Old Town was also full of History and really enjoyable to wander round and taste some of the local foods and crafts. The zoo is a must..... start early though, this will enable you to see the animals before it gets too hot and there sleep time.There is so much to do and see in Balboa Park it's worth spending the day there. Coronado is beautiful. Highly recommend the hotel and the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KimDushinski
Reviews.Content: When the power outage hit San Diego I was in the airport and I did not want to sleep on the airport floor. Quite a few other people had the same idea and we all headed for the Sheraton. When we got there they had a generator powered up and the entry way was well lit to welcome us. Someone was handing out water bottles to the long line of people and assuring us they had room for us. Someone else quickly figured out that the Bay Tower had availability and took a bunch of us over there in the shuttle bus. The front desk staff was hand running credit cards and writing down the room numbers on a piece of paper. Every staff person was friendly and calm. Upon checking in we were handed glow sticks so we could find our way around. They told us they had a dinner buffet set up in the main hotel. Ever staff person there was working efficiently and with a smile on their face. The food was very good and the service was excellent. All this without electricity. It was obvious the hotel staff were prepared and trained for this kind of crisis. If they weren't they sure faked it well. I was so impressed with every staff person I encountered and want to thank them for making what could have been truly miserable, something quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Gpsswinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 nights whilst visiting San Diego. My wife and I live in England now, but she is born and raised in San Diego. Stayed in the Bay Tower as opposed to the main building, The Marina Tower, it was much quieter & all facilities from the main building are just a short stroll along the marina pathway. All aspects from housekeeping, dining to facilities were excellent. Be prepared to pay for parking $22 per day. This seems to be the norm throughout.

Reviews.Title: “I had the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lu28
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with my stay at this hotel. I loved our view, our room, the staff, the pool; I can't say enough good things. I got a great rate from priceline.com and it was worth every penny. I got this room for my boyfriend for his birthday and we had such such a memorable time. We sat out on our balcony, drank champagne and enjoyed the stunning view of the marina. The bed was incredibly comfortable and it was difficult to get out of bed in the morning to make it for the breakfast served up on the top floor at the club lounge. The pool next to the marina was very enjoyable and we even mosied over the hammock for a relaxing siesta. I would definately go back and recommend it to people visiting!

Reviews.Title: “No power and NO problem”
Reviews.Author: AV8R4AA
Reviews.Content: As a professional pilot I get to see a LOT of hotels all across America. Just so happened that my trip ended up in San Diego at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina. That evening there was a complete power failure in the southern California area. The city and 5 million other people were without power and in the dark. As a crew for a major airline we went to check in at the hotel for the night. That is where I met Mr. Scott Hermes. I think he was the manager of the hotel. Anyway, he explained what is happening at the hotel that evening. I was very surprised to learn that just about everything was running perfectly ! The elevator was working, the staff were everywhere with handing out glow sticks, and the Restaurant was open for business! I went to my room and changed out of my work clothes. I then went back downstairs to Join the fun. The bar was open and serving cocktails, and people were in a calm and festive Atmosphere. I was a little hungry and decided to get something to eat. I waited maybe 4 minutes to see the hostess. She had a nice table for me with a nice candle lit near the water. Quickly a waiter showed up and told me of the buffet. I went to graze the food. The staff had excellent hot and cold food to offer. I had some sliced beef and some tuna salad. Both were superb. My hat is off to the entire staff of the hotel. ALL were very gracious and concerned for their guests. It was as if they do this disaster drill all the time. There were some emergency lights on at the hotel and they were more that enough to see your way and enjoy the evening. Except for my room not having any power, the entire experience was a enjoyable night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR LUGGAGE”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Sept 1 after waiting about 20 minutes in line. Went up to our room on the 6th floor & put the key in the door, opened right up, walked in & saw a laptop & luggage on the floor. We left the room immediately. We went downstairs & asked for a manager. They told us it'd be about 10 minutes and offered a front desk clerk offered to help. I explained what I concern was. What they did for me was "upgrade" me by giving me a room 1 floor higher & gave me free breakfast. I didnt want/need an upgrade, I wanted this to be noted & addressed by the manager, not to be 1 floor higher & offered the same breakfast 3 days in a row. Had I not already paid for the hotel through Priceline, I would not have stayed there. I made sure we left our valuables in the car. I will not be Priceline'ing a "4 Star" hotel in the SDdowntown area again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie52339
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is very inconvenient for activities. Sheraton should provide a shuttle to downtown area and other places, not just the airport. Unable to walk to anything and felt like they know that and therefore charge outrageous prices for drinks and foods. Room was just okay. Cleaning Service was extremely slow and hallways were not always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a break and received it. Thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Laxmanboiler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time with my wife and small children for an intended 5 day stay in San Diego to visit the tourist spots. Unfortunately, my kids became very ill the 2nd day of our stay so we needed to leave and head back to Los Angeles. The hotel was fantastic about our circumstance refunding the remaining days of our reservations with no penalty and allowing for a very late check out. Although I probably would select another hotel next time better suited for families, it was obvious that this is a very good business hotel and I will definately be returning. Also, a big thank you to Julia and Hayley for their great service on that troubling Friday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Close vicinity to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: gz138
Reviews.Content: Didn't get bothered by the noise of the planes at all. I know there were some noises from them, but very manageable. The hotel is very nice and the food was very good! Valet on the other hand is very expensive $30 a night, and we stayed for 7 days, ouch. The pool and hot tub was excellent, they warm up the pool and the hot tub, is well, hot, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Location just out of downtown. Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: stevefantana
Reviews.Content: stayed in the bay tower. Very close to airport and free shuttle available. Lovely helpful staff. From reception to hse keeping. Rooms lovely decorated and very spacious. A fridge in room would be a great addition. Nice pool and hot tub area. Larger bay tower facilities available to use to all guests. Five minute walk away. There is no bar and grill that is open all day in bay tower. Opens periodically in the evening. Bus stop is a ten min walk and its only ten minutes to downtown. 15$in a cab to downtown. The extras in this hotel are very expensive. Parking $20 per night,movies,mini bar etc. Removing points for no wifi in each room and the lack of a always open bar/grill. Wifi only available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Poor Service - Bay Tower”
Reviews.Author: csmirasol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bay Tower for a friend's wedding from August 25-28. First of all, they messed up the reservation I made through Hotels.com. I specifically requested the Bay Tower, but for some reason gave me the Marina Tower. Luckily, they were able to put me back in the Bay Tower. This also happened to my friend. The rooms themselves were clean & pretty spacious. They had nice views of the water and the marina. The service at this hotel was horrible. The night before I arrived, I called to ask if the workstations had MS Office. They could not provide an affirmative answer. Only after I tweeted SPG did I get a firm answer (which is "yes" by the way). Every time my friends would call the lobby, the phone would ring endlessly -- literally. Sometimes, they wouldn't answer. I also signed up for green service, meaning they don't clean your room unless you specifically ask. Well, on Friday night, after I got through to the lobby after at least 8 rings, they said they'd remove me from green service and get my room cleaned on Saturday. Well -- that certainly didn't happen. That was just me. My friend, who was getting married, had a cocktail hour at BTL, the lounge in the Bay Tower, on Friday night. They tried to close early on her because they were shorthanded and the bartender had to get home to attend to a personal matter. I feel sorry for the bartender, but this is my friend's wedding! They have the reception in this very hotel and have a bunch of family/friends staying here. Provide a little service! The Marina Tower pool area is much larger and nicer than the one at Bay Tower. If you like to run, there is a nice path right outside the Bay Tower right by the water that you can run. Overall, if you don't mind shoddy service, this hotel will do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, conveniently near airport, but hold onto your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: sactosource
Reviews.Content: The staff was welcoming, and the hotel was nice. The room was a great size with balcony, and overall a decent place to stay (there are 2 hotels and we were at the marina side). During the day it was a little loud, but this is to be expected being near the airport. My biggest gripe about the stay was being nickle & dimed for everything. Make sure to read the fine print! Two things to be aware of: 1) Not only are the items in the stocked fridge overpriced like usual, you will be charged a 20% stocking fee and taxes on top of the listed price. So a can of Coke listed at $4.50 is really $5.50. 2) It's pretty archaic to use anything other than your cell phone these days, but use the phone in your room at your own risk!!! My wife was feeling under the weather so she stayed in the room while I took my daughter to check out a college she is interested in attending this fall. My wife wanted to check on us but couldn't find her cell so she used the room phone instead...her 2 calls that went straight to voicemail cost us $30!!! I can definitely afford to pay the $35.50 here, but it's the way we were charged that doesn't sit well with me. Charging 12 pack prices for a single can of soda and feeling obligated to add a re-stocking fee and tax on top seems ridiculous. And although the card next to the phone says in small print that direct dialed calls will be charged AT&T operator assisted prices, they forgot to mention "bend over and look out!" But if you don't use the room phone and make sure to read all of the fine print, it was a decent place. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but we looked at the pool area and it looked nice and was clean. Although I wouldn't rule it out entirely, we probably won't be back and will check out another property next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced & in a rather inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: photochick
Reviews.Content: There are 2 sections of this hotel & they are not close together. There was an error with my room type on check in, but a representative fixed the error without too much trouble, other than my having to reload all my stuff back into my car & drive to the other section of the hotel. While they claim to be pet friendly, they aren't as you cannot leave your pet in the room while you go to dinner, etc There is no fridge or microwave, but there is an exhorbitantly-priced motion-sensor minibar--$4.25 for a candy bar that normally costs 75 cents, $5.25 for a 16 oz gatorade, etc There is no wireless in the rooms, just wired internet for $15.99/24hrs. There is free wireless & a guest computer in the lobby. The food is way overpriced & not even very good. The chicken fettucini was terrible--just ordering that from room service without any beverages was $21 for food + automatic 19% gratuity + $3 room service fee + tax. If I wasn't so tired, I never would have ordered from that menu! And if you want breakfast, it $17 + all the above fees for 2 eggs, toast & bacon; coffee would be an extra $6-7 Parking was $22/night The view from the Bay Tower is very nice on the Bay side-- downtown San Diego, the Bay Bridge & lots of sailboats. The price I paid for the room was good because I booked thru AAA, but the mess up with the room type was supposedly due to booking thru another site & not directly on the Sheraton's site-- well, gee, other hotels all over the world seem to be able the handle bookings from sites like Travelocity & AAA....why can't the Sheraton ensure that the correct room is booked?

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family!”
Reviews.Author: Malialyssa
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because of the positive comments we read and it did not disappoint! We were impressed with the spaciousness of the room and my daughters (5 and 3 years old) immediately went out on the balcony to check out the view. I recommend requesting the Marina view in the upper floors. The only downside to this stay is the cost of parking which is $22 per day or $30 for valet. Also, we were here during the weekday and found it difficult to find parking so I can't imagine how it would be on a busy weekend. Overall, it was a fun family trip...pool was nice, clean, and warm. They have a fitness room and small gameroom for table tennis and pool. Oh, forgot to mention that they give you an option to be "green" by opting out of getting room serviced in exchange for $5 voucher which we used for Starbucks...totally worth it since you can call housekeeping anytime for more towels or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't come back, but not all bad”
Reviews.Author: Trigirl92014
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided to book a last minute "staycation" in downtown San Diego for a night so we could enjoy some relaxation by the pool. We booked on priceline and got the Sheraton SD Hotel and Marine for $81, plux tax, approximately $95 - NOT BAD! If I had paid the $169 rate plus tax, this would have been 2 stars for my liking. Valet - very nice and quick, but $30. Seriously? Are we in NY or SF? You can self park for $22. Check-inand Room- Again very nice, but slow. Although, the girl was new. Because I am a Starwood preferred guest, we were upgraded to the 10th floor overlooking the Marina and the pool which was excellent. The room was adequate the balcony was wonderful. I loved waking up in the morning, reading the paper and sipping on coffee while the sun broke thru the morning cloud layer, truly a fabulous way to start the day! I will say it was a long walk to the ice machine and there were no robes (which is unusual for preferred rooms in most hotels) neither were a big deal. Pool - It was right on the bay and in my opinion beautiful. Not because the pool is that great, but because how can you not love being on a pool, with great weather and on the water? From a nine year old perspective, "it sucked". Although, he seemed to enjoy it from the first two hours. But, soon became bored because there was no deep water, slide or other attractions to keep him busy. There were mostly younger kids here, but for a one or two night vacation, perfectly adequate for any age. Pool side service - Was sporatic. It took about twenty minutes to get a menu (2pm) and another twenty to come back for our order. But, once we ordered, the food was very quick and the service was friendly and very accomodating. The food is a mixed bag, my sons pizza was $12 (I think) and was a medium cheese pizza which was way above the standard I am use to for hotel pizzas. He ate half for lunch and the other half for dinner. GREAT VALUE!!!! I ordered a a lemon drink which was awful, but I ordered it that way, so my bad. I was hungry and ordered the fish burrito which was terrible, I couldn't eat it. In all fairness, I was raised in SD and we are home of the Fish Taco, so I should have known better. Oh well. Game Room - Game room, hmmmm. Not exactly what we expected, but turned out ok. The "game room" was a room inside the gym that had a wii in it with not really anything games other than the standard package. Also, the parents need to be in the room supervisng the kids at all times (I get that), but wasn't really how I wanted to spend the day, so we moved on to upstairs. This was FABULOUS! My friend joined me at the bar for a glass of vino while my son played the complimentary Xbox with kids that were coming into the lobby (he was 10 feet from me). This entertained him for two hours and he made new friends. Tapatini Tapas & Martini Bar - I have mixed reviews on this. Scott was attentive and was good with all the clients. There seems to be a mix of regulars here which is nice. They come in for dinner and drinks from their boats. My one complaint which is HUGE is the food. Scott recommended the beef skewers, which I was not in the mood for. His second recommendation was the scallops. I should have known better not to order a scallop tapa from a hotel bar - dumb on me. The scallops were good size, 3 on the plate with I believe walnuts and currants on the bottom, a ton of them. It was super sweet, totally gross and the scallops were rubber. I took one bite, disgusting. But, I took a sip of wine and tried another small bite - even more disgusting. The scallops sat in front of me for an hour until I paid the check. Really? I put my napking over them and my fork and knife, isn't this a subtle enough hint to take them from me and maybe ask me if I want something else? Guess not. My son was having such a good time with one of his new friends I asked them if they would like dessert. They both ordered the apple tart and Hagan Daaz icecream. They were like $11 or $12 each. I'm find with that, but neither of them had more than a bite of the tart and said it was too much crust. I tasted it, yep, not awful, but definitely not worth the money. I didn't complain about that either. As long as my son is happy, I am happy! Here is the funny thing though - when I said it was time to go, neither the new friend or the friends dad thanked either Alec or I for the dessert or said goodbye.....really? Here is why I probably wouldn't stay at the hotel again, but only because I am addicted to my computer and the internet. No wi-fi in the rooms and you have to pay $11.95 to be tethered to the desk to get internet there. The positive is it is absolutely free downstairs and it is very good and a wonderful seating area that even provides computers. If you are on vacation here, this should not be a drawback. Overall, service is 4 stars, food is 1 star and location 3. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and view, somewhat isolated”
Reviews.Author: Calalily7
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at the Sheraton--the clip they had on their website where they were featured on the Today show made the place look fantastic. We were a little disappointed, though. Our first room was so far away from the lobby, and we had a baby and all our gear to haul. The room itself seemed a little shabby. The pool areas, view of the marina, and the grounds were very nice, though. Our second room was easier to get to and had a better view. We had to wait in line for quite awhile to check in/out and it seems they could have used more staff. I did like their on-site laundry facility and computers/printer/internet access. Overall, I thought the place was a bit pricey for the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Vidlen3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina Aug 24th - Aug 29th. I reserved the room about 2 months prior for approx $89 per night on some type of manager's special. When you enter the main lobby, it is the second floor. We stayed on the second floor. Decent 2 bed/room. Bathroom was clean! We had a balcony, but it looked out over the parking lot. Not so great, but the price was good. A better view might have cost a lot more. The big swimming pool was warm. The hot tub was good size. On Friday night, the hotel set up a movie screen so that both the hot tub and swimming pool could watch a movie. That was neat. I have never watched a movie while swimming before. We ate in the hotel restuarant one night. Very expensive. Checking in and checking out were no problem. Plenty of staff, no big lines to wait in. The hotel is walking distance to the airport. I was concerned about the airplane noise. I discovered that anywhere in San Diego you could here the airplane noise; Sea World, San Diego Zoo, downtown, the beach. I consider myself to be a light sleeper. The airplane noise did not wake me up at night. If I was already awake, I could hear the muffled noise from the airplanes. But the airplanes did not wake me up. I saw a sign at the hotel that said parking was $30 per night. We used the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel for checking in and out. During the stay, we used the MTS (San Diegos bus system). A $5 ticket to ride all day on several different buses including the trolley system. The closest bus stop was at the airport. After the first day, it was pretty easy to figure out the bus system. Oh yah, our room had this refrigerator that had juices, pop, and food items in it. $4.00 for a candy bar! Needless to say we did not buy anything. All in all, a pretty good place to sleep at night and do some swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: steve63
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4ngts as part of a California vacation. Initial thoughts were it was too far out but soon realised that this was very much a positive thing and that the hotel is actually central to all the major tourist attractions as you really need a car to do all. We booked the Club Level which I would highly recommend. You get a beautiful room on the top floor with amazing views which ever side of the hotel you are on. You also get access to the Club Lounge giving complimentary contintental breakfast. Free bottles of water, snacks, free Internet access and printing. Our room was very close to the airport but had excellent soundproofing so we were not disturbed by it. Hotel feels and looks clean and contemporary with a nautical theme present. Pool also nice but no shade so didn't use. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Overall excellent value for money and would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “paul t”
Reviews.Author: paul t
Reviews.Content: On family holiday driving through California and passing San Diego for a few nights decided to try Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina as recommended whilst staying at a Westin hotel. Booked through Expedia and just a couple of points as I thought it was one hotel from the photos on the Sheraton and Expedia websites. On arriving at the marina tower 1380 Harbour Island Drive was advised we were booked (and had booked) in the Bay tower passing Carbrillo Isle Marina 1450 H I Drive. On arriving at the bay tower little dissappoined, as I viewed it as a different hotel , about 400 metres plus entrance to entrance bay tower to the marina tower. Booked deluxe room, but I found to be ordinary type room. Bay tower only 12th floor are suites. Buffet breakfast very ordinary in the Bay tower. Also should have checked fees as 22 dollars per day parking, close to airport and informed by reception car park run by different company to Sheraton and fees not negotiable for those staying at hotel (cost me 66 dollars). Good location for old town. I'll give Sheraton a miss on my next visit to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: debnath
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at this hotel for 1 night, it was an amazing experience.The hotel is very close to the airport and the views are awesome. Select a room with a city, marina and a bay view and watch the view from a higher floor. The hotel staff are friendly and this is undoubtedly one of the best hotels we have stayed in recent times.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and kid-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights this July. This huge hotel is basically for tourists, particularly tourists with children, so don't stay here if you don't like lots of kids running around the place and in the pool. The service was pretty friendly and efficient. Unfortunately, the rooms are kind of old and everything in the room shows its age, but the hotel is pretty reasonably priced so you get what you pay for. The assistant booking my trip neglected to put in my Starwood Platinum status and I checked-in quite late and the hotel was very full, so I was unable to get a suite upgrade. But the receptionist was very nice and scrambled to get me an upgraded room on very short notice, so I appreciated the effort. I also got access to the club/lounge, which is quite large and gives a lot of selections for breakfast. I also think they had crab cake appetizers during dinner time, which gets extra credit in my book as I can't eat enough of them. If I ever travel with kids, I would probably come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent SD Hotel near airport and marina. Beware of extras!”
Reviews.Author: JC_Cangilla
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Marina is a decent property--know that is a large hotel, with two towers and a Lanai building-think lots of guests, weddings, events and two packed pools. Location is great--very close to downtown and the Gaslamp, also very convenient to Point Loma and even Sea World in Mission Beach/Bay. We were upgraded by the friendly SPG front desk to the Lanai property. Our ground room had a nautical motif--room was adequate, seemed clean and we had a small (dirtier) patio. There was no wireless internet in our Lanai room. Beds were comfortable; room was slightly loud--our unrelated connecting room had some loud moments. Room service meal was good, came quickly and overall staff was attentive. One thing to warn potential visitors: we did incur numerous extra charges. Internet was ~$20 per day per device. Thus, with two computers and logging in both days (via hardline ethernet), charges were over $80 incremental to our room rate. Throw in $22/day self-parking fee, a decent but overpriced restaurant, and good, fast room service (and a late-night minibar $16 beer), our extras doubled our room rate. Obviously, not specifically the hotel's fault: they were clear about these fees up-front. But, if price is a factor and you have certain expectations of how you stay at hotels, then consider these extras. Overall, a decent hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: quil59
Reviews.Content: I attended some business meetings here and this hotel was by far one of the best I have stayed at. The location is great and views are pitcure taking. Service was impeccable. There always seemed to be someone greeting us in the lobby which was a nice touch. Rooms were clean and well kept. I'm hoping that our company books San Diego as a business meeting again so we can stay there soon. Great job all around!

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque resort in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sdflyer
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for the Americas Finest City Half Marathon and 5k Run and had a room on the ninth floor of the Marina Tower. The room was clean, nice and decorated in a nautical theme. Harbor Island, Point Loma, the marina and the airport could be seen from the balcony. The hotel is very convenient, located adjacent to downtown and the airport. The hotel staff is friendly and courteous. The hotel grounds are nicely maintained and landscaped and the pool areas are very inviting. The only thing I did not like was the $20 charge for parking. The hotel has facilities for conventions. It was the host hotel for the marathon expo and also had other events at the time so it was very busy. After paying the $20 parking fee, were had much difficulty finding a parking spot, day and night. Other than the parking hassles, this is definitely a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE IF YOU LIKE CLEAN ROOMS AND GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrokerPatty
Reviews.Content: I honestly wish I had the option of giving no stars for this hotel because Iâ€™m shocked and appalled at the physical condition of it and at horrid customer service. We booked this hotel way in advance because we were in San Diego for a conference. The only reason why we booked at this hotel was because the conference was being held in it. When we went to check in, they told us that we were staying at their sister hotel which was Â¼ of a mile away and require shuttle transportation. I figured we had just gone to the wrong place, and that the conference was being held at the sister hotel that they were sending us to, but I soon found out I was wrong. We spent one night at the sister hotel, and we were horrified at the physical condition of the room. The next day we were moved to the bigger hotel where the conference was being held, and had the displeasure of experiencing their â€œcustomer serviceâ€�. We called asking for hangers because we were staying there for 6 nights. They gave us an attitude and then took over an hour to get the hangers to us. The food was overpriced, which is to be expected at a hotel, but if youâ€™re going to charge me double, at least make sure the food is worth it. It was not. My chicken was cold, hard, and dry, and my friend was given a cheeseburger with no bun (and no sheâ€™s not on the Atkinâ€™s diet). The Restaurant Serves were rude and one even rolled his eyes when we asked him for napkins. Guests would leave their trays in the hallway after they were done with their food and drinks, and they would be left out there for days; room service did not walk the halls. The two glasses that we took a picture of were there for 4 days!!!! In fact, my husband repeatedly put them in the middle of the hallway so that someone would pick them up, and instead they were moved back up against the wall instead of being taken in to be cleaned. When we dialed 0 for the operator, the phone would ring and ring, but no one bothered to answer it. The charge for parking was ridiculous ($22), as was the internet ($17). As soon as we walked in, we were greeted with a commercial boasting that Sheraton spent $6 billion to renovate their hotels across the country, and I guess weâ€™re paying for it. I think if they could charge us for the air we breathed, they would have. Iâ€™m really wondering where this money went to. Our experience was unacceptable. We were so shocked that we took a photo log. This is not a cheap motel, but a resort. I was disappointed and disgusted. We paid a lot of money to go to this conference, and spent a few extra days there as a mini vacation. This is definitely not what I had in mind. You can take a look at the pictures, but here are some of the highlights: 1) The wallpaper was stained and falling apart. In one spot, there was blood on the wall. 2) The showerhead was coming off the wall, falling apart, and water was dripping. 3) The bathroom was not clean. 4) The lampshade was stained and had a hair from a previous guest still on it. 5) The electrical outlets were loose, old, broken, and corroded. 6) The AC would turn off all by itself, minutes after we turned it on. There was no way for us to tweak it and let the room cool down to what we were comfortable with. 7) The patio outside was disgusting and had not been cleaned. 8) The telephone did not work. 9) There were cups of coffee, but no coffee maker in the room - cofemaker was very dirty. 10) The baseboards were completely banged up. 11) The sprinklers on the ceiling were rusted, as were the AC vents. 12) The pool area was not cleaned at night, so we could see trash and the towels all over the pool area. 13) There was dust everywhere, especially built up in the vents. 14) The layout of the room was difficult. Weâ€™re not dumb people and we work in real estate. We couldnâ€™t figure out where to turn on the lights. The towels were under the sink and completely unreachable. In my past hotel experiences, the towels are always either in the shower or right next to the shower so that they are readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location...”
Reviews.Author: joharala
Reviews.Content: I was initially surprised that we were so far away from the heart of San Diego. Turns out our location was great. Everything we needed was on the property, and just a mile away was an entire shopping center with Trader Joe's and plenty of little restaurants. The kids loved their choices of pools too. The hotel restaurant was outrageously delicious. My complaint would be that the rooms did not feel so clean. I noticed there were dogs in other rooms and our carpet felt a bit dirty. I did not allow my kids to sit on the floor. Also the restroom had some issues, which the hotel plumber was fixing for quite some time. The hotel was nice enough to compensate us slightly, but it was still a little gross and inconvenient. Overall, I think it's at a wonderful location and I would go back in a heartbeat. The views were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: CarloLivorno
Reviews.Content: What can I say of a place where, from the very beginning to the end, everything was absolutely perfect? We stayed for 5 nights after a wonderful bargain booking made last april with Expedia. We were in the club lounge at the 12 floor with the possibility to have a great buffet breakfast and an every afternoon Hors d'oeuvre. The room (double queen) was clean and comfortable for a party of four like us (with two young kids) and the view from it gorgeous over the Bay and the pool. The pool is also a plus and really relaxing with its spa. We really enjoyed our stay and we'd like to be there again sooner or later. The only thing I can say could have been better.....is that maybe 20 dollars a day for the parking it's a bit expensive......

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: jmathew22
Reviews.Content: The first room I got was on the ground floor. When I went on the balcony to work, I found it littered with garbage. I requested another room. This one faced the marina and was nicer. Other issues: - On several occasions, I was unable to reach anyone at the front desk. - For early risers, you should know that the restaurant only opens at 6:30. - The morning staff at the restaurant weren't very friendly. And they didn't appear to be too happy to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: We were at a conference and booked 2 months in advance, when we arrived at 9pm we aere told our room was already sold and we had to go to their other tower in a handicapped, dirty room with only one bed even though we booked a 2 bed room for 2 adults and a child. Our number one problem is with the front desk staff. The women that helped us both at check-in and out was rude, condescending and dismissive. Too much trouble for a mediocre hotel. Don't let them send you to their other tower it is dirty and quite a walk to the main pool and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Lynn7691
Reviews.Content: Room and furniture in room was very small, no safe, not enough towels supplied for a family of 4, had some sent up then would forget again next day, so therefore had to ask 3 times. The location was ok albeit a little near to the airport next door, but the beautiful marina made up for that. Wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with good customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: Generally we stay away from larger hotels as often they lack the personal touch, but that was not the case with The Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. Friendly front desk reception, reservation, good maid service & attentive restaurant wait staff. Rooms are nicely decorated and were clean. We did have an issue with a sheet, but called room service and they responded immediately. Common areas of the hotel are well kept, the grounds were beautifully landscaped, nice view of the harbor and yachts, clean and inviting pools. Hotel location is good, near airport, car rentals and near to downtown. Close to harbor areas, beaches, Old Town, Gaslamp District, I-5. If you have a car you will need to use hotel parking, either self parking or valet, from $22-$28 daily rates. Otherwise you will need to rent a car or take taxi. Public transporation is not close. No stores, shops and restaurants within walking distance but hotel does have several good restaurants including a Starbucks. Hotel is quiet and relaxing and we enjoyed our stay and were not disappointed in our choice. We would recommend this hotel and would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a "5", and Dog Friendly, too!”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: We drove to San Diego for a few days, and we brought our well behaved spaniel. Simply a perfect place for a getaway. We had a wonderful view of the harbor, and an extremely comfortable room with a king-sized bed. We paid the extra $40/day Club Fee; well worth it for the view from the 12th floor, the quiet, and especially the club access--free breakfast buffet (not cooked), free hors d'oeuvres in the evenings, free water bottles and free internet access. The area is right across from the airport but surprisingly quiet, and there are beautiful walking paths all around the harbor for a happy dog to enjoy with her family. Our only negatives are the $22.00/day parking fee (apparently average for the area) and the fact that they Locked Up the Walkways in the evening, (a security issue?) so after the pleasant evening walk, you have to walk twice as far just to get back in. All-in-all, a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: lkepes
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right down the street from the airport. Very clean, great pool, right on the harbor. Free shuttle to and from the airport. Good value. I would stay there again. The only negative is the room was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BN98
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton San Diego on the Harbor and it was not worth it. Everything was overpriced (bottle of water in the gift shop was $4, omlet at their restaurant was $17, parking was $30/night). Since we didn't have a rental car, we felt isolated. There is nothing around there but the harbor. The only decent restaurant on the island itself is Island Prime / C Level (which is about a mile walk from the hotel). We were unable to take a taxi since we had a 6 month old. I rented a car for each day that we wanted to travel somewhere, then returned it the same night to avoid paying the $30 parking fee (zoo and sea world). The room was decent, but the goose down in the pillows and bedspread were shedding everywhere, creating dust in the room. We had a nice view from our balcony of the harbor. If you don't have a car, I suggest the gaslamp district. If you're more into Sea World, then stay around mission bay.

Reviews.Title: “Kids LOVED this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jandjfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3-story non-tower rooms and was pleasantly surprised. I guess if I didn't have a beautiful view of the Marina it would not have been so nice. Mind you, our last stay in San Diego was at the Hyatt Mission Bay. The rooms were clean however wish the beds were queens vs. full size. My 8 and 6 year olds LOVED the pool and nightly movie. They also loved the WII room in the fitness room which was a nice touch because it allows parents to workout while the kids are safely playing in the WII room. Kids also played ping pong and pool. There is also a nice walking trail along the Marina. Although we didn't do any water activities, it was all there conveniently located on the Marina. We did do the Pirate Adventure Tour and would recommend it to families with young children. Cost was $30/adult and $26/kids. We are Starbucks addicts so we loved the on-site location. We ate at the breakfast buffet and it was actually pretty good except NO pancakes or waffles, which my kids were disappointed with. Otherwise, a nice selection. The free internet access area was great providing guests free use of about 10 computers with big computer screens. Overall, my family really enjoyed our stay here and would definately choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: IsraelSue1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We got two connecting double rooms and both rooms were very spacious for our family of five. The rooms were clean and well equiped and the view across the Marina was fantastic. We ate breakfast at a small cafe on the water front just under the hotel which was very good value. The hotel is VERY close to the airport but we did not hear any noise from there at all.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddytvs
Reviews.Content: Great hotel stay. The hotel is clean and the staff are great. Everyone wanted to help. Service in the bar was prompt. This hotel is in a great location to DT and only a 5 dollar cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: 911SC
Reviews.Content: Booked here for two nights. Arranged a club room but wasnt entirely sure we got one as it wasnt on the club floor and we had to ask twice for confirmation of the club lounge detail/arrangements. Big luxurious and very busy with holiday makers and conference guests in full turnout. Although hard to find real fault, we didnt really enjoy this hotel. Found the restuarants and bars very expensive and the staff not particularly helpful. Location mixed. You cant walk into town from here and next time we'd pick a hotel which is closer. That said, we did go sailing on a yacht in the harbour and the Sheraton was ideal for that. VERY close to the airport but to be fair we didnt hear noise. Very plush but lacks the personal touch

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graf1
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three year old for three nights. We ended up originally in the marina tower and decided to switch to the lanai section. I know some reviewers didn't lime this section but we loved it. We had a wonderful view of the water and were right next to the Pools but the best part was no elevators to deal with which was a treat with a three year old. Room was super comy and nicely decorated. Starbucks was right there which I liked. The only thing I didn't live was the cost of parking but the service and everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nursejenny37
Reviews.Content: Just returned August 16th, all in all this hotel is good not quite up to the Sheraton standard though, the rooms are clean the bathroom could use a fan, and it would have been nice to have a fridge in the room, the beds were comfortable . We had a room in the Marina tower which is the bigger of the two towers we had a room facing the city/Airport which at first I thought might be an issue (noise from Airport) but actually it was not an issue you do hear airport noise whilst sitting on the balcony but when you close the door you donâ€™t hear anything, the walls had good sound insulation which is good because Iâ€™m a light sleeper and I did not experience any problems. Food is fairly expensive here we booked a package through Allegiant Air and received breakfast free everyday which was great you had the choose of buffet or menu breakfast it was good, we ate in the bar once food was ok! There are no restaurants close to the hotel so if you donâ€™t eat at the hotel you would have to go downtown which is a 10 minute drive away, if you donâ€™t have a car like us you can take the hotel shuttle to the airport then take the bus to downtown a little inconvenient but it worked. The pool is very nice lots of chairs to lounge around on they do have a pool bar which is convenient the staff do walk around to take orders, I found the food here a little greasy for my liking. The hotel does have lots of conferences here but it did not affect us to much they have a big conference centre so they are really well take care of over their own side of the hotel. The hotel front desk staff we found to be very unfriendly it seemed like they were going out of their way to help us, on the over hand housekeeping went out of their way to help you and were very friendly even though English was clearly their second language. Parking your car here is expensive $25 a night and more for valet parking however most hotels charge the same rates. It would have been nice if they had a shuttle that took you to the downtown area where you can pick up a bus or the trolley system which is very easy to get around on.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: CakeySteph
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline.com (4 star, Downtown). I was a little disappointed initially to see the distance to downtown and the gas lamp district. However, upon arrival was pleasantly surprised to see how easy it was to get to the beach, La Jolla & downtown. Since the hotel is right by the airport, you can follow signage and get to it easily and quickly. PRO's: We stayed in Bay Tower with awesome view of the harbor. So relaxing to sit on balcony and watch boats arrive in the evening. Comfortable bed Modern Decor My husband doesnt like coffee and loved the coffee here. Hot tub has beautiful view of harbor (pool is average at best) CON's: As discussed in other reviews airplane noise is a big factor if you choose this hotel. It did quiet down between 10 pm and 5 am. Be careful in the parking lot, it is not well lit at night and the cement blocks go between instead of in front of cars - dangerous! For those wanting to go car free, too far to major attractions. Slow elevator

Reviews.Title: “Some pros and some cons”
Reviews.Author: maxmanmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The hotel seems to be able to handle a large number of guests; there were 1,000 present at the conference and also some little league baseball teams. The lobby, business center, and fitness center never seemed crowded, but the Starbucks had long lines and the pub restaurant was busy, understaffed, and hot. I stayed in the Marina Tower. Check-in service was prompt, courteous, and friendly. I can say the same for the parking valet and concierage. My room was very clean and comfortable.The bed was great, and room service was reliable. Unfortunately I was unable to get a room with much of a view, but the 5th floor was quiet and I was never bothered by noise from the airport or other quests. Also, the conference facilities were great with prompt attention from the tech team. So on the plus side--very nice room, clean and quiet, and overall wonderful service. Now, the cons--as noted by other reviewers--the hotel is isolated. If you want to see San Diego, you will need to rent a car, and if you rent a car, you will have to pay the outrageous (in my view) parking fees--$22 per day for self park, $28 for valet. I would prefer to stay some place where I could walk to restaurants and shopping. Secondly, in-room internet is costly, although wi-fi is free in the lobby. Finally, the food and drinks in the on site restaurants were mediocre and way over priced, and the restaurants and bar always seemed to be understaffed. I spent two nights checking out restaurants in the Gaslight District. I would recommend taking a cab rather than driving, as parking was scarce and very $$$. Also, the evening scene there is not very family friendly. Try Fred's for Mexican or one of the reasonably priced Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Three Star”
Reviews.Author: Brad1962
Reviews.Content: This is an old tired property that tries to pass as a 4 star hotel. The Lanai Building portion of this property offers a two star experience. Seriously, the folks at Starwood need to downgrade to a lesser brand and lower the rates. On the positive side, the staff was friendly and helpful and the lobby was well appointed. The problem is the room, hall ways, elevators look and feel like a Motel 6. If you are paying less than $100, then you are getting value for your money. There are much better options closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient location.”
Reviews.Author: Mluca9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 minutes from the airport and free shuttle service is provided which was a big plus considering we had our toddler. The property is amazing, we had an awesome view of the marina. The beds are first class, very comfortable and the restrooms are spic and span.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Tower = 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: DallasBlonde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three days for a conference. The hotel is acutally two Sheraton hotels - the Marina Tower and the Bay Tower, which are about a 5 minute walk apart from each other. I was in the Bay Tower...which is a 3 star hotel that's trying really hard to be a 4 star. And it looks like it's trying. The hotel overall is decent - the rooms were lacking in my opinion. Nothing was by any means impressive. I think the Marina tower must be a lot nicer - at least the lobby and amenities make it appear that way. I can't say that I was ever in a Marina tower room, I can only assume that they're nicer than those in the Bay Tower. The rooms were loud, I could hear doors slamming and toilets flushing at all hours. I'm a light sleeper so this was especially irritating. The rooms had that moist, Mexico feel to them...always just a little bit damp. That has a lot to do with being right on the marina, but when I first checked in, the AC was completely off. That doesn't help either. Overall, the room was very clean, housekeeping came everyday. Staff was friendly, which always goes a long way in my opinion. Only two elevators, which are slow. I ended up just taking the stairs most of the time. Meeting space is nice, lots of rooms/ballrooms between the two towers. Parking is not free and neither is internet access. If you drive, keep your room key handy in the car. You'll need it to enter AND exit the parking lots. (I chunked it into my purse on multiple occasions and had to dig for it while cars lined up behind me. Sorry cars.) I think parking was $11/day and internet was $12/day. It added up though. Also, when you get there, the first hotel you'll see is the Marina tower. You won't see the Bay Tower. So, valet the car or just leave it running at the valet station - do NOT park - go in and check in. There's a chance you're in the other tower and lugging stuff back and forth is annoying. For the nightly rate, I think it could be nicer. The views are good - either of the marina or the bay. It's definitely in a GREAT location relative to the airport; only a couple of miles away. I'd say good location overall actually, it's within about 5 miles of everything: Fashion Valley, the Gaslamp District, Little Italy, etc. Also, great running trails just outside the hotel...run along the marina, watch the boats, it's pretty key for runners. Room Service food was surprisingly good, however. Recommend the crab cakes. Watch out for the service charges, they caught me off guard. And if this is your first visit to San Diego, take a sweater and pajama pants. I was cold pretty much every night.

Reviews.Title: “No Redeeming Qualities”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrvlr300
Reviews.Content: Check-in took 45 mins., then my room wasn't ready at check-in time, was offered a room in another bldg. "right next door" or a two-hr. wait for my room. The bldg. "next door" is actually about 1/2 mile away and has very limited services, internet service is really poor and only available in certain parts of the hotel, no pool, no coffee shop (when I asked about a Starbucks in the bldg. they referred me to the in-room coffee). There is a shuttle between the main hotel and the satellite hotel......but it takes you to the main hotel via the airport!! Very poor service all-round and obvious it starts with the management. By the way, this hotel is right next to the airport so you will need earplugs if you still decide to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary get away.”
Reviews.Author: zumbadancer
Reviews.Content: This trip was a gift from our children and spouses for our 40th Wedding Anniversary. Don't let our age bracket influence you in a negative way. We saw all different ages that stayed here and everyone seemed to be smiling. The room was large and very clean. No complaints at all. The Sheraton is about one mile from the airport and consists of two separate buildings, a five minute walk between them. We were told upon arrival by a cab driver that the Marina building was for the younger crowd and the Bay Tower building was a little more relaxed. The only complaint we had was the Starbucks was in the "other" building. We didn't rent a car the first two days. By the third day, we rented a car as the cab rides were getting expensive. There's a lot to keep you occupied: Old Town, Balboa Park, Coronado Island, USS Midway, San Diego Zoo, Littly Italy for dinner, Boat rides, Seaport Village to people watch and coastal drives. Oh, and Tijuana. Keep an open mind and enjoy the vitality there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families. No good for Business”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average. The pool and view are super and the rooms recently visitied. Howver, the TV in my first room did not work and it took 45 minutes to switch rooms. The gym is SMALL compared to the size of the hotel so very crowded. The bar/restaurant is average. Service is decent but food was average. Internet is $18 and self prking is $22. I would not stay here again unless my children were with me.

Reviews.Title: “just fine ... until checkout”
Reviews.Author: bhmathome
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and comfortable. Restaurant staff courteous and fun. When we checked in we asked for confirmation that parking was included in our room rate (booked through Virgin) and we were told it was. This was very, very clear. When we checked out we were asked whether we wanted a receipt. When we asked what for, we were told the $88 parking charge. When we told what happened at check in we were told "she [the lady at check in] is new". An excuse? Eventually the charge was removed but it stained our stay. The attitude was unhelpful and obstructive. Avoid this hotel unless you enjoy a fight. Would have given it 4 or 5 stars but for car park charge con. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding”
Reviews.Author: KarenH92807
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline.com for $85.00 per night. When we arrived, the parking attendent checked his list and we were told to go down the street to the Sheraton "Bay View" to check in. Right away, I was dissappointed as I wanted to stay at the Sheraton "Resort" with nice pools and a marina to walk around. Since I belonged to their points club, the desk agent gave us an upgrade to a higher story room where the views (which were absolutely beautiful) would be better. It's a good thing that the patio had chairs as the room itself was a dive. Barely a 2 star place. Upholstered sofa and two chair/hassocks were stained and filthy, the aircondition duct was hanging down from the ceiling, walls so thin I could hear the people in the room above us going to the bathroom. Self-Parking was $28.00 per day; Valet was $32.00 WiFi was $17.00 per day. THe next day when checking out, I wanted to speak to the Manager - unfortunately, another desk agent told me that all the management people were housed at the "Resort" The best thing was Deana at the front desk - a real people person with excellent skills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, service needs refinements”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDawg78
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we got to the hotel early and we didn't really expect our room to be ready yet. They offered to call us when it was ready but we waited to 3PM, check-in time, and there was no call. Back to the long line at the desk. Long since there was only one person waiting on guests checking in. In fact, we rarely saw more than one or two people at the reception desk, therefore there was always a long line of tired travelers. Our room was still not ready so we were given a room with the city view, which is very nice but faces the airport and freeway so is substantially noisier. Back to the line for another 10-15 minute wait. Can we wait for our original room, we ask? There was no record of our original request. Okay, so we head out for dinner, the parking gate was not working properly. Back to the line. They explained there's something wrong with the computers and to just use the assistance button at the gate. Later after dinner, can't get into our room. Back to the line. My husband gets two new cards and we are assured they work. Breakfast in the club room the next day. Can't get up with our cards. Back to the line. Computers still malfunctioning and we still can't get out of the parking lot, the lot for which we paid $22/day. My recommendation, Mr. Manager, hire an IT person and some more desk assistance. The bar in the hotel had some very good drinks, food and service. Although when people were 3 deep at the bar, the bartender had to leave the bar and find someone to help him. You guys could use an extra hand at the bar, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property-just be prepared for terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: heebs77
Reviews.Content: Overall large rooms in the Bay tower where we stayed-( called in advanced and requested this tower as per other reviews here) Got a great deal through price line, HOWEVER- they treat you like you shouldnt even be there. Treated the " Gold" customers as such, but the " price line" was not only brought up to me, but the front staff were quite snobbish. While the restaurant and cleaning staff were fantastic, the desk staff should be run through a course again...it was quite brutal. Sure glad i dont ask alot of front desk staff....will never stay at Sheraton property again. The location, while it may seem far away for visiting, was actually very easy to get to local attractions-Zoo/Seaworld, etc....expensive parking but it is becoming normal at higher end hotels. Overall I'd recommend if you get a name your own price...but I wouldnt pay full price for this hotel. I got it for $100/night BTW

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the level of service”
Reviews.Author: lharral
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with my wife for 6 days attending a real estate conference and stayed over several additional days to enjoy the facility. On the day before my departure, I lost my digital camera. I left word with the front desk to watch out for this camera since it had many of my business and well as personal photos on it. One day after my departure and having returned home, I was thrilled to hear from them that a similar camera had been turned in. I had several conversations with Nicolas confirming that it was in fact my camera. He was kind enough to make arrangements to send the camera back to me. He was very courteous and helpful in taking the time to help me. We really enjoyed our stay and were very impressed by a number of the employees. We look forward to returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, to close to airport”
Reviews.Author: sandiegolover12
Reviews.Content: sheraton san diego was one of the best hotels i've stayed in a few years. the staff was friendly and helpful. the only trouble's i had with this hotel was the airport. the hotel is right across the street. the last day i was there, my wake up call was the fire alarms going off but it was a fun experiance. i would stay at sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and location more oriented to business clients but clean with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more oriented towards the business traveller, evident obviously by the location by the airport, but also the excessive internet and parking charges. The parking charge is $22.00, per night! How ridiculous!! The internet was about $11.99 per 24 hours, but you could get two free hours if you were near the lobby, or in the foyer of the marina tower there were PCs and I think you could get on them for free. Excessive extras I believe. Despite this, the hotel has very big, nice rooms. We were in the Bay Tower, with a view on the bay side which was really nice. The balcony gets some sun around the middle of the day. It is too far to walk into the city, so a taxi or drive yourself. We drove, and got free parking in the gaslamp district, but it was on a Tuesday night and I believe free parking hard to come by at the weekends. Gym free to use. Really nice hotel, nice pool, but just a bit far out and with the extra costs on an already expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: annar76
Reviews.Content: Loved our weekend here. Such a beautiful location. We only ate one meal at the hotel. Food a little expensive, but good. Beautiful, modern room. Housekeeping very good. VIews AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nothing around it”
Reviews.Author: ecotravellor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by the airport. The restaurants are barely adequate and you cannot walk to anything. Parking is expensive so having a car is not a great option (it is actually cheaper to park at the airport itself and use the shuttle to go between your car and the hotel). The rooms themselves are nice and the whole hotel is clean. If you miss the maid service in the morning, it is unlikely to happen later in the day. Staff was friendly and helpful. They did know the ins and outs of airport travel through Sand Diego. The convention space staff did not seem to be able to adapt quickly. Rooms were kept at a near freezing level.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for 4th of July fireworks!”
Reviews.Author: dab11822
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for the 4th of July weekend and found it to be the perfect location. The hotel is very large and has 2 large buildings that surround the marina. We had a bay front balcony that provided us a beautiful view of the San Diego Bay and an unbelievable view of the holiday fireworks. 4 simultaneous displays from one side of the bay to the other. It was amazing! The staff, the room and the amenities were very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A nice way to be introduced to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: elainie2c
Reviews.Content: I liked that this wasnt right in the city, we had a rental car so that was okay for us, as I couldnt do alot of walking anyways. Be mindful its right near the airport, though it didnt bother us. We got a concierge room it had a balcony and beautiful view of the San Diego skyline. Behind the hotel is a nice marina view. Outdoor pool looked nice but we didnt get a chance to use it. Stay in the Marina tower, its definitely better situated. The concierge lounge had a complimentary continental breakfast which was perfect, included hardboiled eggs and oatmeal with usual continental fare. Appetizers from 5-8 were just so so - asst of nice cheeses, nice croissant sandwiches, but only two hot items, one was cheesesticks that were not very appetizing, I liked the mini egg rolls. The attendant there was very slow, I had to find her to give my drink order. We also bought a AAA package which included the self parking fee and gave us $50 food and beverage credit which made this a great value overall. You cannot walk easily to downtown from here, but their restaurants appeared to be quite nice onsite. I was a bit perturbed at checkout, she wasnt very nice, there was an error on my bill, she did end up taking care of it, when I thanked her she didnt even respond, I was about to complain to her manager but I had one foot out the door so I chalked it up to her having a bad morning and let it go. I found it very clean and comfortable, but would probably stay closer to the city on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Rick30
Reviews.Content: Great place for a buisiness meeting, shuttle buses from airport. Beautiful location surrounded by marinas and boats. Great pool as well. Quiet, away from craziness of downtown

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Shotgun_Joe
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this place this week. It was OK. The lobby was nice as is the bar. The breakfast restaurant is very expensive for the mediocre food. I thought I was in the main tower, but alas my room was in another tower which was a 500 yard walk from the main hotel. The view was nice, but the airport is just to the North so it was a bit noisy. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I'd look elsewhere on my next trip. San Diego has better hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: lrieg01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean.Staff was ok some of the women at the front desk came off with a bit of an attitude.My family and I stayed at the bay tower.I had no idea that the resturant/lounge was only opened for a few hours in the morning and evening.The baytower had a small pool.In all fairness its a few minute walk away from the main hotel that has all the amenaities that are listed on the website.We never expected to pay for parking at a hotel you are are paying to stay in.$22 a day.They do offer a "green" option where you get a $5 coupon good toward breakfast.What they dont mention is that a cup of coffee or juice is $4 alone.I wish they would of let us know they were more of a "business" hotel I know my family and I could of gotten more for our money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you have a rental car, great deal and location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my 20 year old daughter. We stayed on the club floor which was nice especially for breakfast daily, and ability to get bottled water anytime we wanted. Although we didn't spend a lot of time at hotel, when we did we enjoyed it! Favorite staff member....Scott, the bartender at Tapatinis for sure! He was entertaining and pleasant. We took advantage of the "green room" choice and instead of housekeeping we received $5.00 every day under our door to be used anywhere in the hotel. We still asked for extras of anything we ran low on, and always received what we needed. Only complaint is that parking is a little high.....$22.00/night is exhorbitant! and $28/night for valet was out of the question for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Towers”
Reviews.Author: Phil6184
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here the last week of July. This is a very nice hotel with two towers that are very different from each other. Depending on your tastes and needs it is important you are given a room in the appropriate tower. The main tower is called the Marina Tower. This is where you will find the main lobby, bars and restaurants. This is also where you will find Starbucks (open 5:30 for us early risers). The main pool is here as well. This is also where you will find the majority of the noise and commotion associated with a large resort like hotel. The smaller Bay tower is located a 5 minute walk away. It too has a bar and restaurant and pool, but everything in the Bay Tower is on a smaller scale. I found it to be perfect for my needs. The rooms are large and well appointed. I found my room to be clean. I asked for a higher floor and was placed on 11. My room looked down on the Marina (lots of sail boats) and also had a view of the adjacent airport. I spent a lot of time on the balcony watching the marina and airport activity. The opposite side faces the bay and some might prefer that view. If you are worried about sleeping noise the airport is quiet at night and I slept very well. I made the walk between the two towers several times a day and found that I enjoyed it very much. Had the weather been bad I might not have felt that way. I did rent a car while here and found the hotel close enough to all the attractions. You can self park your car if you want to. The Bay tower is much closer to the car park. There are 2 restaurants off the hotel property which are walkable. The first is The Lighthouse and it is very good (I highly recommend it and you will need a reservation). The second, The Boat House, is closer but I found the food and service to be terrible. This is a very nice hotel which can offer two different experiences at the same time. Just choose the tower which fits your needs and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “What a neat experience in a fantastic location. Resort-like.”
Reviews.Author: TheShadow32
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Diego and this hotel was huge. It had two towers. It has all the amenities of a nice resort. We were there on July 4th and got to experience the fireworks right outside the hotel! What an experience. We will definitely stay here again when back in San Diego. You cannot beat the views of San Diego and the staff is eager to help meet your needs. The club lounge is extraordinary with breathtaking views of the city and bay. This hotel is reasonably priced considering other hotels in the area that have less amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: sref63
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the marina. Nautical theme. Very nice. Pool area is awesome. The outdoor bar/lounge area is a great place for cocktails, and the waitstaff was top notch. I Would definitely stay here again ! 4.8 Stars

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, well out of the way”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a one night stop over to or from the airport. The rooms are well appointed and to the usual Sheraton standard. Internet access is extra but there is free wifi within the confines of the business centre (next to the bar). The hotel is a long way from San Diego centre though (over 2 miles and a $10 taxi ride to anywhere of signficance - although if you're on a budget you can take the free 15min frequency shuttle to the airport and then the Holiday Inn shuttle to the Holiday Inn which is at least walkable to the USS Midway and beyond that Seaport Village and downtown). The main disadvantage I found was that I was located in the annex which is a LONG way from reception (especially if you have bags etc). Obviously, as the hotel is near the airport there is some plane noise though I slept soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Season S
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel this past weekend it was 3 adults and 4 kids (ages 4, 10 & 13) and we got an amazing rate by calling the hotel directly, and using our AAA discount. We got a rate of $119/night per room, non-refundable. They had a huge lagoon-pool overlooking the beautiful Marina. Both sides of the hotel overlooked the Marina so all rooms probably have a nice view, and the hotel and rooms were all newly renovated/updated in a nautical theme. The lunch in the sports bar off the lobby was good and the staff was helpful and friendly. Although you do have to basically drive through the airport to get to the hotel as its right in the airport area and seemed to be mainly a hotel fcatering to business travelers. If you want to go anywhere you do need to drive, but its very close to evreything - about 10 min to the Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! See you again next year!”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveller68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across from the San Diego Airport...and because it was our first time in San Diego, it was very convenient. When I booked this hotel, it was because of its proximity to the airport and the shuttle to and from it. I did not want to worry about how long it would take for me to get to the airport and be late for my flight. Reading some reviews from a different website gave me second thoughts, but I did not have to worry, because this hotel was just GREAT! The service at the front desk was great, very friendly and courteous, the valet people were very nice, too. The room was just perfect with a PERFECT VIEW of the city and the bay and the marina. We are SPG members so we got the higher floors, and the view alone was well worth the stay here. the pool, like the other reviews, was also very nice, with a spa. It wasn't busy at all, the showers were conveniently located in the gym, and they provided the towels at the poolside. Our stay here was staggard because we had to travel to another city for the weekend, so when I booked, I booked two different kinds of rooms, the last one was a studio type, which I liked very much, too. Very spacious. Although, the drain of the shower in the studio type was slow...that was the only set back, and we only stayed in it for one night, so I really didn't mind it that much. Parking was indeed steep, at $22/night, but hey, it wasn't that bad finding a spot anyway. You just had to go tot he opposite lot, everyone tends to turn right upon entering the hotel driveway, but really, there's another lot on the left side and we always found a spot to park there. And it wasn't even a long walk. So overall, I say I loved staying at this hotel and I will certainly come back! Thanks Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “No service”
Reviews.Author: BriMo72
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and love the location. First time I was here our family loved everything about the hotel. Room was clean and well maintained, view was exceptional, and staff very pleasant. This time, the complete opposite. Room is dusty and dirty. Air conditioning unit sounds horrible with water sloshing around inside of it. Called front desk twice and was assured they would send a technician. Departed room in morning for day out in SD sunshine. Returned to room to find the a/c unit had not been touched. Received no indication, note, message, or anything that would indicate the issue was even being addresed. Poor service and unacceptable for a room they charged $250 a night for. Will avoid Sheraton from now on. Too bad because this can be a great hotel, given the right circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mspeppy
Reviews.Content: The entire stay was abolutely wonderful! The rooms, the staff, the service was exceptional! A very friendly and fun atmosphere, extremely family oriented. It was a wonderful stay!
