Reviews.Title: “Great access to airport - but feel like you are far away”
Reviews.Author: boog89
Reviews.Content: Given its proximity to the airport - you can call it an airport hotel - but it is nothing like an airport hotel. On the marina - spread out - large pool, etc. I found it very convenient for a conference I was in San Diego to attend (ADA). Loved the proximity to the marina for my morning run. It is not near the Gas Lamp/Downtown area - so you will need to cab or shuttle to get to other places. I was in the tower closer to the lobby - which I would reccommend as it looke like the other section of the hotel was a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Two towers, it just depends what's important to you!”
Reviews.Author: markthefish
Reviews.Content: Lovely floral entrance/driveway and smart lobby with VERY busy Reception desk. There always seemed to be a queue of people! Internet centre (free in the lobby) then there's a Starbucks and then the main restaurant. Outside is the lagoon style pool then the lanai accommodation and they have their own pool. Well equipped fitness centre. This is all part of the Marina Tower. So if you are looking for all of those things, stay here! If you are looking for something a bit quieter, large rooms, a restaurant, standard pool but still with views, either looking towards the marina/ airport runway or city view/Coronado, then this is for you. The wireless internet is only in the lobby but is free. The restaurant serves all the major fodder for a night's hunger pangs and a small bar. Open for breakfast but I wasn't going to pay $9 for a bowl of oatmeal. Instead, on the Marina path inbetween the two hotels buildings was Papnani's convenience store and cafe, mostly geared towards the boat owners but it did me just fine! My major complaint was about the shuttle service. It's a nightmare! either there's not enough drivers or vehicles, I don't know what but it look a long time for a vehicle to turn up at the airport. There were quite a few waiting as well as Airline Crew and then getting a shuttle back again took a while because they had to locate it then send it to the building you were in!! It didn't drive round all the time like it should! The frustrating thing is, it's across the road from the airport and it is walkable but with luggage, maybe not!! If you don't have your own transport it's a bit restricting. If you opt for the Old Town Trolley Tour, once a day, it will pick up outside the Marina building, ask the Concierge! All in all, a good hotel in a lovely location. My room in the Bay Tower was big and bright with a sunny balcony! I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: katwoman46
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean hotel. It is right on the Marina literally accross from the street from airport, yet we didn't hear any noise. One of the quiter hotels even when busy. Water views on both sides, so no matter where your room is the view is nice. Near downtown and the Zoo. However it is pretty far south of the nicer areas like La Jolla and Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamVGroton_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Marina Hotel for two nights while visiting our daughter. The Sheratonâ€™s location is just beautiful. The hotel and the rooms were outstandingly clean. The staff was very welcoming especially to our granddaughter with us. Their hospitality and genuine customer care was so refreshing. We got in very late, because of airplane problems, so it was so nice to have the staff so accommodating and pleasant. The pool area was wonderful, we used the larger pool all the time but there even was another pool at the hotel. Great pool games for children. The food was excellent, breakfast and eating lunches at the pool (they even had steel drums playing one day, which was great). While all the staff was friendly, Ronnie, the food manager, was awesome! He is probably one of the nicest and friendliest people there. Thanks Ronnie for making our stay at the Sheraton so memorable. We highly recommend this hotel and we will be back again to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: lightniter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference so this review won't speak much in terms of value since the company paid and I'm not sure how much the room was. But in terms of location, it was great! Great jogging/biking paths from the hotel to Seaport Village (3 miles) and downtown (worth the walk if you don't mind walking). I rented a bike from the hotel (great deal!) and biked all around Sunset Cliffs and Pt. Loma (~5 miles to the Pacific coastline for amazing views!). My room itself wasn't the best. It was ground level and hence, had to have my curtains drawn all day, leading to a dark and dreary room. The pool was nice, with hammocks, and a recreation center. Not many breakfast/snack options though. Starbucks had the monopoly there, but there's also a sandwich/cafe shop midway between the Bay and Marina towers. Excellent location for taking in the beautiful coastline, both night and day! Convenient location for me due to the conference, but also convenient for exploring all my favorite spots downtown, all managed w/o a car!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, quality staff and excellent services”
Reviews.Author: Belfast-Will1975
Reviews.Content: We booked this holiday for its Bay-side location for a stay over the 4th July weekend and stayed in an executive club family room. From the minute we checked in until the minute we left, we were completely impressed with the facilities on offer from this beautiful, family friendly hotel. We encountered no problems, price wise we paid approx Â£110 per night for the room, that included continental breakfast in the executive lounge (penthouse) and evening snacks and refreshments. We found the rooms to be clean, fresh and very welcoming. a reasonable ammount of room on the balcony with fine views over the marina. The staff were very efficent, friendly and the services was excellent. We dined at the hotel lobby bar and also had room service and found the food qulaity to be very good and reasonably priced. I would have no problems recomending this property to most travelers. An excellent property.

Reviews.Title: “You Kidding? Not worth the value AT ALL!!!”
Reviews.Author: HongTheArsenalFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, and we definitely will not come back again if we are paying for the hotel. My first impression of the hotel was poor service combined with inefficient hotel staff. The receptionist Juan was checking us into the hotel, and he told us our room was "not ready" and all the other "ready" rooms were full. This is totally unacceptable, given the fact that we were checking in 12 midnight, which gives them 12 hours of room cleaning time and the hotel is only 12 floors tall. Afterwards Juan's manager gave us this room on the first floor, which was really the basement because the lobby is on the second floor. Our room had traces of insects, because the first thing i found was a dead bug on my pillow. Although the room looked clean, you never know what is on the carpet. On the next day we took a walk around the marina, and the only good thing about this hotel is the view (which we didn't get, thanks to Juan and his manager) and the presence of a Starbucks next to the lobby. We are truly disappointed with Sheraton with this stay. I thought an elite international hotel chain like Sheraton could have done better with their customers. We paid over $200 for our room and we didn't expect poor service and a basement room with dead insects. I have stayed in other Sheraton hotels and the rooms and service are on a higher level. Stay away from this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort hotel, great for business too”
Reviews.Author: GregArizona
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 7/17/11 for 4 nights. The location is perfect, across the street from airport, but on Harbor Island. It is a beautiful location and great walking along the bay path in front of the hotel. The hotel has a free shuttle to the airport. This is a 4 star very upscale resort on the bay. The lobby is very nice and great for people watching. We are Starwood Gold members and there is a separate check in for SPG members. There are 2 pools, boat rentals out front, ping pong tables, a spa, modern gym, and a cool area called Microsoft link in the lobby. The rooms are very nice. If possible, upgrade to a concierge room and you get a great breakfast and nice light dinner! The front desk staff and managers are awesome, they were very prompt on a few service request items. I love when they answer the phone from the room...hello Mr.... Downsides are parking price (save money on this...hint...check out SAN airport parking off site rates). Internet is NOT wireless in rooms. If you are flexible on your dates, they have great rates many times. Check on Sheraton web site or Kayak. Enjoy your stay. We are returning next month!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality and Service I have ever experienced Anywhere! I will never stay anywhere else in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: AZTechCEO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina for my middle daughter's wedding in San Diego. I stayed with my wife and yo ungest daughter while my oldest daughter and her husband joined two days later. Because this happens to be a very busy time of year for the hotel and it was a very special occasion for me, I wrote an email to the General Manager of the Hotel asking if they could assist me in some special requests. Please bear in mind that I do not hold special status at Sheraton so it wouldn't warrant special service ordinarily. Much to my amazement and pleasure, I receiived an immediate response from Scott Hermes, the General Manager (who was also off that day) and also his Executive Assistant Helga Crum that they would work to try to accommodate my requests. They provided me with significantly more than I could have asked or even expected! A large room with a view together with a location within the complex that I had asked for and to top it off, they sent a note with a gift of wine, cheeses and fruits to welcome me to their hotel! They contacted me virtually every day via phone to see if I had everything I needed and offered even more assistance. This all came from the senior management of the hotel! And, just so you know it wasn't just the management that provides this service, the room service meals and personnel were equally pleasant, the food was great, and the smiles abounded. In addition, the maid service was timely and exceptional. When we needed extra towels and hangers, we received those with the same smile and immediacy of time. The front desk was more than courteous and helpful regardless of which one helped you and the valet parking made an effort to know who I was and which car was mine. Many times they welcomed me back by name. An exceptional hotel with very exceptional personnel. This is obviously a top down personification. If the management is first class, the people will be as well. This made a first class room that much better than any of their competition. As a senior executive, I travel extensively worldwide and have well in excess of 2,000 room nights over the past 10-12 years (yes, you read that correctly) and even with status at other properties, I have NEVER experienced the service, hospitality and genuine customer care that I experienced at this hotel! I can tell you that not only will I ONLY seek out this hotel every visit I have to San Diego, but because of this team, I have become a Sheraton Evangelist all over! I can't thank Helga enough, nor Scott enough! They are by far the best I have ever seen! And because of the service of other members of their team it reflects their value and class of care from the management on down. It may be a four star hotel, but in my book it was at least 5 stars! Thanks again Helga and Scott!!! You're the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but what out for hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: cesmail
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Sheraton for one week. Overall it was a nice hotel. We enjoyed the large pool and great view of the marina. The hotel is a ten minute walk to the airport and about a 50 minute walk to downtown. We did not eat at the hotels restaurant, but did frequent the Starbucks located near the lobby. Another nice feature were the two gas fire pits which are lit nightly and surrounded with rocking chairs. Hammocks were also attached to some palm trees for the guest to use. The hotel will give the occupant a five dollar voucher for use in the hotel if you opt out of daily maid service. We took advantage of this, as they will still bring clean towels and other items on request. We were fist shocked to find out that parking our rental car at the hotel was going to be an additional $22 a day. This ended up costing us an additional $152 which was not disclosed to us when we purchase our package. Additionally, access to the internet from our room would be another $11+ a day. This was also a surprise as most hotels now provide internet access for free. One last thing, the hotel is somewhat isolated from stores, restaurants etc. so be prepared to pay higher than normal prices at the small store located near the lobby. I.e. a ice cream bar was $4.50+.

Reviews.Title: “Annual 4th of July Visit was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Boltfan_ScrippsRanch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married at the Sheraton on 9/19/98 and have been going back ever since. Now we have two beautiful girls and have started a tradition of staying at the Sheraton (4-5 nights) for the 4th of July to enjoy what the property has to offer and the Big Bay Boom fire works show. This trip we had issues with our rooms we had reserved a year in advance with confirmations check-ins 6 months, 3 months and 1 month out the day we did check-in on July 1st. After trying to resolve the issue at the front desk with no resolution, my wife asked to talk to a manager. Daniel Ader was very receptive to our issue with our room. With a busy 3 day holiday weekend Daniel went above and beyond customer service to upgrade us from what we had reserved. By jumping through hoops to help us out we had one of the best times with our family and friends while staying this past 4th of July weekend. We also would like to thank a few others for their customer service, Lea, Jamie from the shoreline (pool bar & grill), Jake from the spa and Francisco our waiter for dinner at the Harborâ€™s Edge. We didnâ€™t get the names of the two employees who manage the kid activities/games but they also did a great job as well. Our girls look forward to the games at the pool and love meeting the other kids that participate as well. We are looking forward to next years visit to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: victory1094
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Very busy the fourth of July weekend but they did a great job of keeping everything easy and smooth. Very nice location just far enough outside the city but close enough to get to whatever you want to

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper187069
Reviews.Content: So disappointed...this was our final hotel in our family road trip down the California coast starting in San Francisco, passing through Carmel, Santa Barbara and Los Angeles and ending in San Diego at the Sheraton Marina. We had fantastic experiences in the other hotels - the Westin in San Francisco, Carmel Valley Ranch in Carmel and W Hotel in Westwood Village, LA were stand outs for service, hotel locations, facilities and all had their own unique wow factors. The Sheraton Marina had none of the above. We stayed in the second, smaller and definitely second rate Bay Tower. The rooms were fine apart from the noise of the ice machine across the corridor all through the night. It was unclear just how close the airport was from the web site (literally behind the hotel), so noise levels were unexpected. The lobby staff were miserable, we were never greeted with a smile and when I called guest services with a query about coins needed for the laundry, the guy said he didn't know and left it at that! Great training and service (not)! The public areas need serious upgrading and the bar and restaurant area was uninviting and dead most of the time. The pool was appalling - small with a bar area that was closed when we were there and seriously out of date. We felt like poor relations to the guests in the main tower where lobby, bar and pool areas were far superior. Not sure if the staff also felt miserable to be working in the second rate tower, but their indifference to service and general apathy was very disappointing after the high standards we had experienced through the rest of our trip. There were however 2 excellent restaurants a short walk from the hotel with incredible views of the San Diego sky line and marina (particularly at night) which I would highly recommend - The Lighthouse and Island Prime.

Reviews.Title: “great wiews of the harbour. we saw the 4th of july fireworks from our balcony”
Reviews.Author: johnfromwollongong
Reviews.Content: older hotel but rooms were clean and had great view. you would get a great view from most rooms unless you were in the bottom floor. we had the harbour view and our teemage children had the marina view. both were good but we preferred the harbour view room. there are 2 separate towers which are 5 min walk apart. we stayed in the smaller tower. the pool and gym is smaller but we could use the one in the other tower if we wanted to. The parking can be a problem so i would go with valet parking if possible. good base to explore sandiego. it is about 10min drive to the gas lamp area/the main tourist strip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Despeaux
Reviews.Content: They completely screwed me over. Overcharged, gave us a cheaper/smaller room than we paid for due to overbooking, parking lot took a half hour to exit from due to broken equipment, they lost our registration info, tried to say we didn't have club access, forgot our free breakfast, tried to charge us $300 for a 28 minute phone call, tried to charge us $160 for minibar use (I didn't touch it)... And had snotty attitude to boot. Just go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: forrest_79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marina tower for 4 nights.... nice hotel. BUT.... local calls were $2.00 each time. and the sports bar downstairs was way too overpriced. Also, there is really no form of transportation other than taxi and a complimentary shuttle to the airport. So, every time we wanted to go anywhere we would have to add at the very least $30 to our day out just to get to and from anywhere. I would never stay there again. I would chose somewhere closer to downtown or even on Coronado Island... at least you can take a bus or walk to a restaurant. we felt forced to eat at the overpriced restaurant at the hotel because we didn't want to take a cab every time we wanted to eat. Another thing... my husband called front desk to ask where the nearest liquor store was. they told him he'd have to cab it to the nearest one which was 10 minutes away. Well... our last day there we went walking and bought a sandwich at their deli in between the bay tower and the marina tower. (by the way great sandwiches for a great price) turns out, they have wine & beer right in that deli. So FYI for those staying there..... the deli in between hotel was awesome!!!! they also had breakfast there for under $8 per person. Can't believe we found all that out on our last day!!! Hope we have saved a few $$ for all of you who are staying there :)

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Sheraton Marina”
Reviews.Author: Raymond1212
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. During checkin I found out the room had one king bed. I requested a room with 2 separate beds as there were 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids). They said that is an upgrade and the cost is $20/day extra. They also charged $22/day for parking which I felt was high. During checkout there were several charges amounting to almost $30 which I could not recognize. It turns out that they have sensors on the snack cabinet and by merely opening the cabinet, they charge you even if you did not use any of the snacks. They took out those charges without any fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Nicolas and Brian”
Reviews.Author: tgirlsmom
Reviews.Content: I left my Tiffany bracelet and ring in my room recently and did not discover that fact until I was going through security at the airport. I have not had good luck in the past with lost jewelry from a different chain of hotels (B.W.), so my first thoughts were that I would never see my jewelry again. Once through securtiy I called the Sheraton, still not thinking I would ever see my jewelry again. What a pleasant surprise to learn from Nicolas (Lost and Found) that Brian (Security) retrieved my jewelry! Nicolas was very helpful in making arrangements to have my jewelry sent to me. I am so thankful to Brian and Nicolas for their honesty and professionalism in returning my jewelry to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: elcapytan
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for a 3 day class. The room was neat and clean. Great view of the Downtown and Marina. Restaurant was very good as was the outside pool area. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations...we won't stay anywhere else in San Diego!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rcurtis226
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sherator San Diego Hotel & Marina for the first time recently. We stayed for about 11 days, and had an incredible experience. The hotel is beautiful and accommodating and the entire staff was very pleasant and helpful. We visit each year, and this facility far exceeded our expectations. We will be back here every year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hatethesnow77
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good thngs about the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. I stayed with my husband and 2 year old son in the Bay Tower for 4 night July 6-10. Had a wonderful room facing the harbour. We loved being able to watch all the boats move about the harbour and had a great view of the Carl Vinson and Midway aircraft carriers. Rooms where spacious for a hotel room and had plenty of room for a crib. Also, absolutely no airport noise during the overnight hours. The grounds and buildings are clean and well kept. Everything, in my opinion appeared to be fairly modern and up to date. The pool at the Marina Tower are amazing and loved the poolside service. Being from Chicago the rate for valet ($28 a day) seemed more than reasonable and the valet staff was quick, friendly and eager to help or offer directions or recommendations. If and when we return to San Diego we'd definately stay here again. Thank you Sheraton for a great experience during our short California vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveller-one
Reviews.Content: Very ambivalent about this property - not nearly good enough to earn serious accolades, but not bad enough to be trashed. Go there, expect not much and you won't be disappointed. Proximity to airport is an asset; the view from rooms higher up is very pleasing in pretty much any direction. I would probably stay there again if the price was aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “Meh!”
Reviews.Author: purpleravioli
Reviews.Content: Just a typical hotel. Tons of weddings going on so lots of drunk people stumbling around the lobby. Also, we stayed in the Bay Tower facing the airport...bad idea. Planes start taking off at 6am so if you like to sleep in I suggest staying on the other side of the the Tower. Also, the breakfast buffet at a Holiday Inn Express was better than this one. And for $19 per person I expected alittle more. My husband asked if they had any everything bagels. The hostess said "No we don't but everybody asks for them" WOW...just wow. It's very clean and very average. I guess it's good for families and weddings. Also $28 for overnight valet parking ($22 for self park) and $18.95 for one day of internet access. Just crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, our whole famly will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: surfin_sunsets
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I got the room as a gift from my Aunt and Uncle for the 4th of July weekend. We had no problems checking in, it was quick, easy and the lady who checked us in was very nice!. We absolutely loved the nautical style of decor considering we both work at a yacht club. That might have been the best that we've ever slept, the beds and pillows are out of this world comfortable. Rooms were clean, new furniture and a nice flat screen TV. We are so incredibly pleased with the fact that the WHOLE entire hotel is pet friendly, which we have a 5 month old puppy who loved the stay as much as we did! We had only a couple issues that were resolved very professionally. Parking is $22 a day which we didn't realize until we pulled our car in a parked, the hotel paid for our first night as a courtesy. We also had a small dining issue and the F&B manager Ronnie Hauptmann completely took care of us and went above and beyond to make sure our experience was amazing. The stay wouldn't have been as enjoyable without the care that he gave us! Very professional, courteous and hospitable. The front desk employee named Pedro gave us complimentary breakfast after we had a bad experience with the hot tub, again went above and beyond to make our romantic stay pleasurable. I spread the good word to our family who will all be staying there again next year! Again thanks to F & B manager Ronnie Hauptmann and guest service employee Pedro for taking the extra step to make our stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - OVERCHARGED”
Reviews.Author: JaySFBayArea
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is OK, particularly if you are in the main tower, but management and staff are untrained or liars. Upon checking in I asked if there were any view rooms in the main tower or suites available (as a Platium guest I get a free upgrade). I was told that only rooms in the other tower were available. So off to the car and the other tower where we went to a room with virtually no view and strong cigarette smell. I made a quick call to a manager and was told there were view rooms in the main tower or I could choose a suite for my free upgrade? Back to the car and the main tower...getting exhausted now. Finally they overcharged me $184 versus my confirmed rate of $109??? Worst of all was the treatment I recieved from the Manager (Dena) when I called to get this corrected. First she treated me like I was lying (forward me your confirmation!), then she tried to explain that it was just the taxes etc... When I interupted her to explain it was not the taxes she became enraged that I called her lady and not by her name, sorry I forgot. There was a huge toyota meeting and they were treating those people like royalty and everyone else seemed to get second rate treatment, I heard that from other guests as well at the bar, not professional (I believe that is why they were holding extra rooms in the main tower?).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ATMCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a convention. The hotel is ideally situated near the airport and offers excellent views of the harbour. Staff was professional and friendly, rooms were clean and well kept. The only downside if you do not have a car is the cab rides to Gaslamp square. Would definately stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, Not a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beluga01
Reviews.Content: The Hotel isn't well maintained and the noise from the nearby airport make for an unpleasant destination.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for super early flight departure”
Reviews.Author: silvergate
Reviews.Content: Seeking a hotel in close proximity to the airport with reliable shuttle service, we chose the Sheraton across from the airport on Harbor Island. Unreliable taxi service from hotels further afar in the past made this hotel an easy choice, its shuttle begins operating at 4:45a.m. We booked a standard room in the Harbor tower and were in no time checked in by friendly staff, upgraded to a 10th floor room with balcony and a beautiful view of the comings and goings in San Diego Harbor. The room was very large, well appointed, brightly lit, spotless, including the carpet which appeared new. A super large king bed with soft sheets and good pillows made for a good night of sleep. Airport noise was not audible at all, but walls do not completely muffle very noisy Vacu-flush toilets in adjacent rooms. A 48" flat screen TV, safe, stocked mini-bar, and a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee packets, desk and a comfortable seating group rounded out the amenities. Not quite up to par was the on-site restaurant which is really a dimly lit bar with tiny round tables, more suited to have a drink than to have dinner (the actual restaurant area is roped off and set aside for breakfast use only). Wanting to have dinner we chose from the limited menu a light meal which was tasty and met our needs. Danny who wears the hats of bartender, waiter, busboy and does everything but prepare the food he serves with a smile as well. Only one other person ate in the restaurant, which may be an indication that other nearby establishments on Harbor Island are a better dining choice. Nevertheless, the hotel perfectly matched our needs, and should we have another flight at an ungodly early hour, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: Warrioir
Reviews.Content: I left behind in my room an important bundle of papers. Nicolas of the Lost and Found Department couldn't have been more helpful. Not only did the maids do a wonderful service in finding and turning in the papers, but Nicolas was right on top of the issue and got them mailed to me right away. Great hotel and great people!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KNTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego for a long weekend back in May. The hotelitself is nice, I think it just went through a renovation. We stayed in the Marina Tower and had a great view of the pool and the marina. The room was spacious and clean. The grounds were nice and the area surrounding the hotel was also nice, with a great view of downtown San Diego. The hotel is very close to the airport(virtually across the street), but hearing the airport noise in our room was not an issue and both my fiance and I are light sleepers.The parking situation was the only thing we were unhappy with. First off, the daily parking fee is astronomical. Second the parking lot itself is very difficult to navigate because a portion of it is blocked off so if you go down a row and cant find a spot, you have to reverse to get out of that row. Third, we kept having trouble with the key reader and had to make several attempts each time we exited the parking lot to get the gate to open so we could leave, which was extremely frustrating. Overall this is an average hotel, not high end or filled with luxury, but clean and in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Memorial weekend”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoGrobatrotz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Stayed there before. Fairly excellent location. $10-$12 cab ride to most everywhere one wants to go--Old Town, Sea World, Downtown. Right on the water at the marina with a nice pool and outside setup. $22 a day for parking is a bit stiff if you have a car, but it is understandable being so close to the airport (they don't want airport parkers). Starbuck's on site makes coffee choices numerous and easy. One restaurant is on the spendy side, the other is a bar scenario and a welcome respite at the end of the day. Free wireless in the lobby and a big bank of computers for free use just beyond the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CherylNewB
Reviews.Content: The customer service was above and beyond any that I have experienced & I have traveled all over the world. The rooms were beautiful and spotless. Absolutely would stay again. Great views from most rooms. Good food too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of downtown skylight”
Reviews.Author: wt88
Reviews.Content: Use price line bidding and got this hotel. Not much of a saving using price line. There are two towers for this hotel, one is the Marina Tower which is across from the airport. This is the main tower with all the amenities, large reception area, free computers, larger pool, spa, etc. We pulled to the front of the Marina Tower and the bellman checked the guest list and told us we were at the other tower, the Bay Tower. It was efficient and we didnâ€™t have to get out of the car. The Bay Tower is Â¼ mile around the corner from the Marina Tower. Itâ€™s doesnâ€™t have the glamour lobby. There was only one computer in the lobby. It has a small outdoor pool next to the parking lot. It feels like lower class in the Bay Tower. Parking was $22/day. The room key card worked fine for the parking access. The front desk staffs at the Bay Tower are efficient, but indifferent. Theyâ€™re not rude but not friendly either. Theyâ€™re just doing their job to check you in, check you out and answer your questions. The hallway was dim, not brightly lit. The room is renovated and spacious. Each room has a wall to wall balcony, great view of either the harbor/downtown or the marina with boats. We did hear the airplane noise and it woke us up early in the morning. No need for wake-up call. Firm bed and king size pillows for king size bed. Sheets are winkle free. There is mini bar and youâ€™ll get charged if you removed an item, even if you replace it. There is no fridge in the room. The bathroom was small but it has everything we need. The hotel is in Harbor Island, away from the busy downtown, yet itâ€™s very close to it. It has a great view of downtown skylight at night. . Itâ€™s also next to the airport so we can hear the airplane noise from our room. Itâ€™s also close to Balboa Park, the Zoo, Sea World and other attractions. There is only one restaurant near the hotel. There are no other restaurants and stores near the hotel. Itâ€™s kind of isolated. This is a great alternative to staying at downtown or hotel circle or mission bay. Short drive to attractions on local road, no need to use the freeway and stuck in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay....Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dkm021
Reviews.Content: We were only in San Diego for a few days to visit family. The location was fabulous. We were put in the Bay Tower and had a lovely view of the marina. The staff was wonderful! Especially Bibi from security. I told her I had lost my Blackberry adapter and she found one that I was able to borrow for my stay AND she delivered it to my room. Now that is service! I would definately recommend this hotel and when we return will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Treatment - what a hotel stay should be”
Reviews.Author: SunLoverinCA
Reviews.Content: I try to get out on occasion and "visit" San Diego so I don't forget to enjoy the beauty of my city. I had a Staycation at this hotel over the Memorial Day weekend. There are so many great hotels in San Diego and I've had some great stays in other cities as well. I travel a few times each year for business and pleasure - and I can honestly say that this was the best overall experience that I've had. The staff was wonderful. My great experience started at check-in and didn't stop until check-out. The room was quiet, comfortable, and the modern design was so beautiful. The view of the marina was breathtaking and got better with the sunset. I enjoyed lounging by the pool and taking a stroll on the grounds. The dinner from Harbor's Edge was so good and the view of the fireworks at Seaworld after dinner from my balcony as fun. The next morning I capped off my stay with a breakfast (outstanding) and a few spa treatments. Every person that I came in contact with responded as though I was the most important person in the hotel I have plans to return for a personal stay, as well as to bring an event there so everyone can share the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: JimB60950
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a week in May. The trip was a very pleasant vacation in every way. The rooms were new and clean with beautiful views of the ocean. The staff was extremely helpful. I requested a roll away for one night and it came within a few minutes...I was amazed at the quick response. The exercise facility is state of the art!...not your usual cramped little hotel room converted into an exercise room. I left something in the room when I departed. I called back 2 weeks later and the staff gladly mailed it to me at their expense. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: corriegal
Reviews.Content: Our airline's flight and hotel package offered several hotel choices. We liked the look of the Sheraton and marina, but were aware that it was some distance from the downtown area, so we had to factor in extra cost for cabs and plan our days' events. The hotel is basically across from the airport. We heard planes now and then, but it was not disruptive at all. Check-in was very efficient, and extremely friendly (thank-you Dinah!). Arriving in the morning, we expected to check our bags, and get our room later in the day, but we got our room right away. We were offered our choice of the two buildings, and picked the main one, knowing the rooms were smaller but it had more restaurants etc. We were asked for our view preference, and chose the marina view (gorgeous). The room was a decent size, very nicely furnished and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable, and had beautiful linens. We opted for the 'green' choice and didn't have daily housekeeping but towels were replaced upon request. This gave us a daily $5 voucher towards food/beverages, which we used for our morning coffee at Starbucks (located in the lobby). Our package also included breakfast, which is pricey in my opinion. If we had paid off the menu for our breakfast, including a fruit bowl (delicious), juice, coffee and main item, the price per person would have been at least $30. Without having a car, we had breakfast every day at the hotel (food and service were both excellent). Be prepared to drive or take cabs to get around, as there is very little in the immediate area within walking distance. We weighed the option of renting a car vs paying cab fare to get around. Daily parking at the hotel is $22. Added to the cost of car rental, and not being familiar with the area, we decided to travel by cab. Allow (pre-tip, round trip) approx. $30 to/from Old Town, $56 to/from Coronado (hotel Del Coronado), $25 to/from downtown/Gaslamp Quarter. With only 4 days, and much on our agenda, we didn't have a chance to spend time at the pool or use any of the other amenities. Quinn's sports bar was a nice place to end our day (kids are allowed, even though it's called a bar). There is a free computer area for web-surfing, email etc., and for printing boarding passes (note - in-room internet is $11.95/day). Since our room was included with our airline package, it's difficult to rank the value, but while we were there, the 'walk-in' rate was $199/night. We did not use the mini-bar or room service. All of the staff that we met - front desk, concierge, restaurant, bar, valets, cleaning - were extremely friendly and helpful. All in all, we were very pleased with this hotel and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are nice, facilities are poor”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: Checked into a corner bay view in Bay Tower. Room was decor is nice and view is great. However AC can't cool room below 70 ( it's 65 outside), cable TV has no channels. The hotels response was were redoing the cables in the building. Really? No wireless internet and the wired internet ( even with the "premium" upgrade is slow) and if your not a platinum member it cost $18.95 a day. If your looking for somewhere close to the airport to spend a night it's ok assuming they get the TV issue fixed, maybe 1 channel that works. Otherwise you should stay in town, at $28 to park you could stay downtown and be where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “nice quality hotel, but would have preferred being closer to Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: fun-happy-traveller
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, nicely decorated (nautical theme), free shuttle to/fro airport, nice staff Cons: location - would have preferred being closer to Gaslamp so that we could walk there; restaurants in the hotel left a little to be desired I stayed here for a work conference. I think, if I wasn't bound to the location, I would choose somewhere with a better location and food offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Birthday Get together”
Reviews.Author: bubsofsd
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was sensational...service outstanding and the rooms we booked were first class. I highly recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting San Diego. It is located close to the airport, right on the water, with terrific amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in every area.”
Reviews.Author: carolinam1992
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful to our questions. We stayed at the Sheraton Marina which had a variety of restaurants with great staffs, as well. The Marina was very cleanly and comfortable with a wonderful lobby with computers and couches for guests. Although the rooms are just basic, they are cute. The lost and found desk is also very helpful and efficient. They are quick to respond to inquiries and assist you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa1546
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sheraton over March Break. Terrific location. Easy access to the airport and the city. Beautiful views. Nice lobby, nice restaurant,great staff. We enjoyed the ping pong tables in the leisure area. Nice internet lounge in the lobby. The pool area looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rahulc90
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located close to the airport. The marina view was excellent. Enjoyed the stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Good Base of Operations for SD”
Reviews.Author: outof714
Reviews.Content: Had no idea that this was an "airport" hotel until we arrived. Right across the street from Lindbergh Field. That was fine though as the hotel had a nice resort feel to it. Self Park was 22.00 and valet 28.00 or so. Couldnt find a spot so we went with Valet. Service was prompt when we called for our car. We were assigned on the 11th floor of the Marina tower which is the main building with the lobby and restaurants. The floor said Starwood Preferred Guests floor. Thought that was odd, but as an SPG member it was nice to have a high floor. There are 3 separate towers and are actually spread out along the marina. the view of the SD skyline was great as well as the runway at the airport. Im a fan of the romance of planes coming and going so it wasnt too bad. The sound proofing was good as we didnt here to much from the airport. Room is standard size and we had a double. Bathroom was really small with combo shower/bath. TV was also on the smaller side of 32 inches. Room service was available 24 hours and a late night burger after a wedding hit the spot. Hotel caters to the convention/conference crowd. Still felt very welcomed by the staff upon arrival. Access to Downtown/Gaslamp was about 10 minutes and the beaches are another 15 minutes or so. Would rather stay in Gaslamp area next time we are in town. Not a bad choice though if you need to be near the airport and close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKit
Reviews.Content: This property is very good. We enjoyed two nights in a double room in the Marina Tower, overlooking the pool and the marina. There is an in-house Starbucks (I'm an addict-so this was quite convenient) We enjoyed the food and drinks from the sports bar, the outdoor firepits, the walks along the harbor, and the peace and quiet. Even though it's right across from the airport, the plane noise was negligible. We were able to purchase tickets for the Old Town Trolley tour, picked up right at the hotel (at a decent hour, I must add). Truly recommend the experience this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasatic "airport" hotel with great views of the marina and a good pool”
Reviews.Author: dgreenfi
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance and views for an "Airport hotel". Only 2 min away from the airport but feels like its own world. Not the best location for getting to the beaches ($25 cab to mission beach) or downtown ($10-$15 cab), but still one of the nicer airport area hotels i've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View, great location”
Reviews.Author: Oregonian60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the harbor and the view is great. We walked along the water and looked at all the boats/yachts. We were there for 5 days. The restaurant is great, food is good, service was good. The ice cream store became a daily stop for us; also ordered a picnic lunch for one day which was great. The only downside was that we agreed to go green when we checked in which we understood to mean that sheets would not be changed every day. That was fine - we don't change them at home every day. But as it turned out, they didn't do any housekeeping at all. We had to call everyday to have them pick up garbage and bring clean towels. You would think they would vacuum, dust, clean the bathroom, change the towels, empty the wastebaskets. So if you don't care about any of that then go green - we won't do it again! Other than that, it's a really nice place to stay. So because of that, I gave them a poor grade on cleanliness - it was very clean when we checked in, though.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back”
Reviews.Author: captzenon
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Gold Member and I was extremely disappointed by our stay over Memorial Day. When we got to the hotel we were directed to the Bay Tower which I later found out was a Raddison just recently purchased by Sheraton. While the rooms were big with great views the noise level at this hotel was terrible. We virtually got no sleep while we were there. In addition I did not find the staff there were very accomdating or friendly. Would stay at the Westin gaslamp in the future or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “less than stellar experience this time around”
Reviews.Author: TXEditke
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has really cool nautical decorations and I love the fish tank in the lobby. Our room was located right over the pool and it was really really loud due to some music that was being played at a high volume the whole weekend. We asked to be moved to another room, but they wouldn't move us, even after repeated requests. The food in the hotel restaurants was quite expensive, which we expected, but the quality did not match the price. It was greasy and made us feel kind of ill. The best part of the whole experience was when we rented bicycles and rode around San Diego. There is a deli the concierge recommended that was in walking distance...DO NOT GO THERE...rude staff and disgusting food!

Reviews.Title: “Not much from the Outside but a beauty from the inside”
Reviews.Author: TheBune
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in this beautiful hotel which is wonderfully located at the San Diego Marina. If you have the chance try to get one of the upper floors. The southerly view over the Marina is just stunning. The rooms' interiors are modern and it is very clean including the beautiful bathroom. Even we booked on very short notice the rates for the room was very reasonable and the service was just great. Don't forget to try the mind-blowing pancakes they offer downstairs... they're the best I ever had!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jnetterk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our college age kids for spring break. We were placed in the older hotel, which some think of as less desirable than the newer one, but we loved it. The rooms were large and spacious and we had a view of the bay. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego... a hotel experience not to be missed.”
Reviews.Author: travel1234556
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business and individual travelers. It is close to the airport but you do not have the noise of the planes and it offers many amenities for all to enjoy., The staff and service in all departments is wonderful...Most of the employees have been at the property for many years and it has a family feel to all that they do. The food is excellent and a good value for what you receive. All the rooms have a water view..but of course the higher the floor the better. The property is close to downtown and a cab ride away from many activities other restaurants or shopping areas. The meeting space works well for business but it is on the far side and does not bother any of the individual travelers. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a all around good experience while visting and staying in San Diego .

Reviews.Title: “Sue offered her personal items to make up my mistake, BIG thanks!”
Reviews.Author: funone559
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed that "Sue from Chicago" was my angel for offering help last weekend, San Diego Rock and Roll Marathon event. I was unpacking my gear and realized I had two left shoes. Not what I want to realize at 5pm the day before the marathon. I called the hotel line and got "Sue from Chicago" to ask about internet connections so I could locate a Target or something. Sue asked my shoe size and offered her shoes if they were in her car, and could I wait 10 minutes for her break. She met me in the lobby and had actually taken them out of her car. I was so impressed that an employee would offer something of thiers for my event. I want to give a shout out to Sue, and I LOVED the bedding. Two down pillows and two something else pillows. I love down. San Diego. Late check out request. So, this was a great experience for me with the customer service. A bed is a bed, but Sue, you made my evening with your offer and follow up. And the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the city and happy to be!”
Reviews.Author: OC_BH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from June 4-6 via Hotwire, and it turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. We used the self park and checked in at the hotel, but learned out room was further down the road in the 2nd (older/original) hotel called the Bay Tower. I'm glad it was. No room has a bad view unless you're on the ground floor. One side of the hotel looks out over the marina, the other side looks out over the bay and Coronado Island. The amenities are few, as I think the pool was on the roof (never saw signage though), not sure if it had a gym, but the balcony with table and chairs made up for everything. The hotel is ways from Downtown, about 3..5 miles, but very close to the airport terminals. We were in town for the Marathon and resorted to taxis to get around easily. They were even able to take my wife to Sea World (about 5.5 miles away) to meet me at the Finish line. The Valet service was exceptional in helping us (and saving my wife from a VERY DISGRUNTLED taxi driver), so much thanks to them! We loved that this hotel was quiet, away from the Downtown madness was nice, and the rooms were spacious, clean, amazing view, and great for a weekend trip

Reviews.Title: “All the extras really add up”
Reviews.Author: tatcorp42
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was nice and clean and comfortable, they really nickel and dime you for everything, so I would not recommend staying here. You have to pay a ridiculous nightly rate for parking ($22 to $28 per night), you have to pay for internet access and the food in the restaurant is exorbitantly priced and not any better than any other restaurant. They also had the nerve to tell me that I could not feed my baby her baby food at breakfast because it was "outside food." Really? Were they going to go in the back an puree organic sweet potatoes for her to eat? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the efficiency of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ride_hard_yyc
Reviews.Content: Was looking for somewhere to sleep near the airport and booked into this hotel at the last minute. I was extremely impressed with the property and staff. Check-in took less than 3 minutes for my 2 rooms - I've never run into front desk staff so efficient (but still friendly). The hotel is clean and well taken care of. Rooms are reasonable size, beds comfortable. Soundproofing must be extensive, as planes flying directly overhead were almost completely unnoticeable. Great views from the balcony as well. Excellent shower - the best I had on the trip! No problems with this hotel and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay we will be back soon"”
Reviews.Author: gerikMurrieta
Reviews.Content: We are writing this letter to thank you for the voucher we recieved for a stay at your hotel. This allowed us to be away for a night to enjoy each others company and remind ourselves why we are together and how much we love each other. Our son Erik was born almost eleven years ago he has a diagnosis of Tetrasomy 18p, this entails an array of disorders. He has overcome many challenges that most cannot imagine, we have become quite familiar with many specialist, Doctors offices, Emergency rooms, special programs, school meetings to help Erik become as independent as possible. He has been our number one priority and has never been without us at any time over the past eleven years. It was the first time we have spent one entire day alone with no children during that time. We cannot describe how wonderful a day we had we would like to thank UCP and the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina from the bottom of our hearts and may you recieve many blessings. From the bottom of our hearts, Gary & Alma Johnson

Reviews.Title: “Exllecent hotels and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Allen_Tang
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and hotel is very nice. I spent an enjoyable month here

Reviews.Title: “Booked on Priceline - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a long weekend trip to San Diego to visit some friends that live in the area, and booked this hotel by selecting a 4-star "name your own price" deal on Priceline. I believe we only paid $95 per night. Overall, for $95 a night, this hotel was excellent value. We had a nice large room, with a balcony overlooking the marina. The room was spacious, clean and had been renovated, although the hotel itself is quite old. We ate the breakfast buffet which was also good. PROS: - Excellent value @ $95 per night when booking on priceline. - Good breakfast buffet - Great location (close to Downtown and the Airport) - Nice, clean, spacious rooms CONS: - Older Hotel - Rates may by higher when not booking through priceline

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 4 star”
Reviews.Author: detjason
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip. Got a great rate compared to the downtown hotels. This is the only hotel that is at the entrance to the airport, so if you want an airport hotel, this is it. It is also right in the middle of the marina with boats and beautiful views in every direction. Check in was quick because it was late night. Got upgraded as a SPG member even though I was paying a very low rate. The room was bigger than average because of the curvature of the room. Exceptionally clean with 42" flat tv and nicely decorated. King bed was big and comfortable. I only heard one plane before I dozed off, but the room is sound proofed well. The lobby is bigger then most hotels downtown. It has a great social/computer center with free Internet and computer use. There are two restaurants and two different bars, and a full service Starbucks. Although the prices for food in the bar were high, I think they are on par with most 4 star hotels. While the menu had some high priced items, there were many items in the $12-16 range. Although parking is $22, this is the same if not less than what many 3 star hotels charge downtown. I have paid as much as $36. Since there are dozens of hotel choices in the downtown area, this hotel only makes sense for me if I don't need to get around the city. Although only 2 miles from the heart of downtown, it is on a peninsula and a little detached from anything other than the marina and airport. On the other hand, it's location provides great views, particularly at sunrise and sunset while viewing the big city in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: azgirls2011
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this great hotel and the service was even better than ever. The location is perfect for us, within a few minutes of all the great San Diego beaches and parks. From arrival to check out the staff could not have been nicer, they were very warm, genuine and welcoming. Especially Chris at the front desk and the servers in the club lounge and the harbors edge restaurant. We enjoyed great food and a lovely comfortable room with gorgeous views overlooking the Marina. Our toddler was mesmerized by the amazing yachts in the marina and the beautiful aquarium in the lobby and our tweener loved the 'link' in the lobby. Our favorite spot was the firepit by the marina, the perfect place for sunset.

Reviews.Title: “at a time of extreme emergency, the Sheraton was there for us”
Reviews.Author: erv_travel
Reviews.Content: while dining in the lobby restaurant on May 14, 2011, my wife suddenly had a massive brain aneurism and was gone in a flash. Throughout this terrible emergency, the Sheraton and its personnel were very kind and gracious to me and my family. I would highly recommend this hotel above any other in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and friendly serevice”
Reviews.Author: LesfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We love staying here. Strongly recommend you join SPG rewards and get an American Express SPG Rewards card. Had a great view of the harbor on our last visit. Also, we left an item in the room and the lost and found staff was very efficient. Nicholas found the item and it was quickly sent back to us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a couple of problems”
Reviews.Author: biodtl916
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel and experience was nice. We did run into a couple of problems that will have me looking elsewhere to stay next time even though we are SPG members and try to stay at Starwood properties when we can. The first is the pricing in the restaurants. Obviously all hotels charge a premium but charging $8 for a kids meal which consists of a stale Smuckers Crustable? Second is the parking situation. At $22 a day, which again we realize parking is always going to be high and we spent $22 at the next hotel we stayed at on this vacation, although that was for valet parking. The lot that you park in is a dirt lot that is easily 1/2 mile from your room while they are allowing non-guests to also park in the lot for a fee which makes it even more difficult to find a spot. On check out when we mentioned the parking lot issue the SPG desk clerk acted as though she had no idea what we were referring to and really didn't care. If your room is near the pool be aware that it is very loud. We had to finally call at 11:30 to ask them to turn down the music which they did but it was amazing that they let it go that long.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: lipnmin
Reviews.Content: We love staying in Mission Bay when we come to San Diego but wanted something different. I got a good deal on hotwire. Location was nice. Next to the airport but the sounds weren't too bad like other peoples comments. (and I'm a light sleeper) We stayed in the lanai section and loved it. It was a 3 story building next to the main hotel. Loved the 2 pools and view from our room. We had a view of a pool and marina. It was also close to the parking lot and didn't have to deal with the lobby area. We even watched the fireworks from Seaworld from our hotel. Parking is alot but you pay that at most 4 star hotels. The only complaint I had was the bathroom was very small. The door would hit you when you were sitting on the toilet. When you have small kids, that's not fun! Was also hard getting into the shower/bath if the door was open. Loved the starbucks and computer lounge area in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Beautiful view.”
Reviews.Author: J_Chat7
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, I was pleasently suprised with this hotel! We stayed in a room on the 11th floor of the Marina Tower, where we had special access to the Club Lounge. We got a good deal on the internet on this room with special access to the Club Lounge for a free continental breakfast every morning. Our room was nice - we had a view of the water (the Marina and the pool). The only thing I didn't like was the pillows were not very good, also they did not have a single towel rack in the bathroom!!! That was quite a pain, especially with 3 of us in a room using towels. The restaurant's in the hotel were O.K. They were quite expensive. A drink at Quinn's was $12, and pasta with chicken was $21. They also let you take drinks down to the pool, which was nice. In the evenings, Quinn's and Tapatini were quite popular places to be. I really liked the atmosphere. It was a great way to relax and meet new people! The area around the hotel does not have much. There are 2 other restaurants that are able half a mile, and a mile away from the hotel. Island Prime and Tom Ham's Lighthouse were both worth walking to. We ended up taking a taxi home because we were too full to walk. We used taxi's to get everywhere because we did not want to worry about trying to use the buses. Taxi's are a bit more expensive than the buses and trolleys, but it saves you tons of time and hassle! The free shuttle to and from the airport was very nice. I loved the view from the hotel. Being right on the ocean and in the marina was beautiful. The paths to walk along the ocean were very nice. I would suggest requesting the Marina Tower, as it is the part that has all of the amentities. The Bay Tower is a little ways away from the main tower and does not have any amentities. The service we received at this hotel was great. Check in was quick. Room service was quick. The concierge was AWESOME! and the bell boy's outside to help us in and out of the taxi's was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean. Not a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: flaura
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family over an early Spring Break in April. This is not a true 4 star. It felt like a 3 star. Not plush in any way. Very basic. Plastic cups in the bathroom. Nothing special. Though the hotel is nice and clean. It is an uneventful place to stay. It is walking distance to some good restaurants. But you have to get in your car to go to any other fun places in the city. Parking is $24! My 7 and 5 year olds enjoyed having the marina to look out to every morning. Other than that, there was nothing for them to do in the hotel. As the weather was drab. We stayed in the new building. I was told the older building had more to it. Starbucks and such.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jenwads
Reviews.Content: Perfect! The beds were comfortable, and I was able to sit on my private patio in the sun. Although it is not downtown, it is very close! A trolley shuttle runs in the morning and a free airport shuttle is available too! Free internet in the lobby means keeping in touch and you can look up things to do. The pool area was beautiful. The only issues were an ill informed concierge, and they did not restock the minibar. The restaurants in the hotel were very good, and I especially enjoyed the Tapa/Martini bar - ask for Scott! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie32987
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the Gator by the Sea festival and stayed at the San Diego Marina Hotel. Right next to the airport. I have very very happy with the hotel. The rooms were natical themed and very comfortable. Went with friends and they came to our room that night and we played cards and had a bottle of wine and cheese my daughter had sent me for mothers day thru room service. It was fantastic. Then when it was time to hit the sheets I was double impressed. The sheets were so nice and new. They were like sleeping in brand new sheets for the first time. I was overly impressed with the Sheraton. Definately would re-visit. Debbie Schlotbom

Reviews.Title: “awesome elegance”
Reviews.Author: tatay439
Reviews.Content: great room and price. very upscale environment. luxurious, plush. store for amenities on property. courteous and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chcurtin
Reviews.Content: I was little nervous about the hotel when reading all of the negative comments. I went there for 4 day and 3 nights for work/leisure with family. Check in really quick and the front desk was very courteous. Room was very clean and the view was good. Some airport/airplane noise. They could use better quality of toiletry. Bed was fantastic!!!! Somewhat of limited parking...parked in the dirt parking 3 out of 4 days but it was only 20 yards of extra walking. Ate at Quinn's...good service and decent food. Went to Starbucks for 2 breakfast/coffee....employees need to stop yawning when working the cash register (both days). Otherwise, good hotel and good employees!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mauiwaves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, up to date and very close to the airport (but not in the flight path so not too much noise). The price seemed high, but then again everything is outragous in CA. We were at a conference and the hotel did a good job putting it on. Had one lunch in the bar and it was tasty. It is fairly close to downtown (about a $15 cab ride to Petco Park). The exercise room was as good as gym.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: matchsticklady88
Reviews.Content: If I had any negatives to say it would be that the mattress was really firm. Personally I do not like a firm mattress, thus, my back was bothering me. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The bayside view was wonderful. The location is great and getting to the main attractions is easy. I would strongly recommend this hotel to others and definitely plan on going back. I am VERY critical when it comes to hotels so trust me when I say this is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but secluded with $22 parking!”
Reviews.Author: Lizardo23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister as we were planning her destination wedding. We got a great rate on hotels.ca, however, when you factor in the $22 parking, it doesn't seem to be as great of a bargain. There is absolutely no street-side parking, and a car is mandatory given that this hotel is located close to the airport and basically far away from amenities and tourist attractions (Coronado, Balboa Park, Mission Beach, Fashion Valley etc...). The rooms were fantastic. It was very clean, and spacious, and the gym is fantastic. There are many cardio machines, however, the free weights are geared more towards men than women. There is an excellent running route along the bay, which I enjoyed immensely. There are free computers with wireless in the lobby, or you can use your own laptop. Unfortunately, the wireless did not reach our room. It may be a good idea to ask for a room close to the lobby so you can use a smartphone in your room. In sum, the rooms were great, however, it was a bit far away from the sights. I would recommend this as a transit hotel as there is a free airport shuttle a couple times an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Dohl
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff. Great location! We stayed in the main building and it was beautiful. The rooms were clean and very tastefully decorated. It's next to the hotel, but we never once heard the planes. My only gripe is the parking fees. $22 a day for self-parking and $28 for valet. We decided to valet since there was an event going on when we arrived and self-parking was pretty full. The valet service was awesome. We would call down before leaving the room and our car would be waiting for us when we got to the front door. Just wish they could give hotel guests a break on the parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ALG731
Reviews.Content: I recently took a day trip with friends and we stopped into the spa at the Sheraton for massages and some relaxation, and it was amazing! The staff was extremely helpful, the spa director personally came out to greet us and ensured we had any and everything we needed through the afternoon, the front desk attendant was extremely pleasant and helpful and the masseuse (I had Gary, highly recommend!) was spectacular. After my hour massage, I was so relaxed I didn't want to get up! Afterward my friends and I hung out by the hot tub and pool for the remainder of the afternoon which was great to continue our day of relaxation. The hot tub was spacious and the pool temperature was just right, plus, not too mention the great view of marina...it doesn't get much better than that! All in all it was probably one of the most relaxing days I have ever had and I can't wait to plan the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, but remote”
Reviews.Author: curiousgeorge1052
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton with my wife and two daughters (ages 6 and 3). From reading other entries, I realized that I should request the Bay Tower, which I understand the rooms are a little older (although recently renovated) and a little bigger. We stayed on the eight floor, which had a great view of San Diego Bay. Our stay included the weekend, so we had a great view of the boats traversing by. One factor to consider is that the Bay Tower is approximately a quarter mile from the main facility at the Marina Tower and Lanai areas. I didn't really spend time at the other areas, but I heard that the amenities (business area, resturant and pool) may be a little nicer there. We wanted the bigger room and the view. We did have breakfast at the restaurant at the Bay Tower. It is buffet-style with the basic bacon/sausage, eggs/omlette, potatoes. There are also breakfast pastries, oatmeal, cold cereal and fruit. It is nice, The cost is what you would expect from a place higher-end hotel like the Sheraton. The pool area at the Bay Tower is a little small. There is also a hot tub. If the pool area is of particular interest for your family, I'd suggest staying at the Marina Tower and/or Lanai. Because of the weather, we didn't use the pool. Location is a bit remote. Hotel is right across the entrance to San Diego Airport. I could see how it would be convenient for a business meeting with people flying in from across the country. However, it is 10-15 minutes away from Horton Plaza/Downtown/Gaslamp District. It is about the same distance to Balboa Park and and the San Diego Zoo. As such, you will need vehicle transportation to enjoy the sights and sounds of the city (and pay for parking at most places along the way). Self-parking was $22/night. You use your room key to get in and out (so make sure you have it). It is commeasurate with the downtown hotels. I'm note sure why it is so expensive, but make sure that you factor that into your plans. The Wall Street Journal and USA Today were available in the lobby. In all, we had a good stay at the Sheraton. We really enjoyed the view from our room. However, the location is a bit farther away if you were expecting to be in the heart of the action in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: bllrm
Reviews.Content: Good sized room with nautical theme, balcony with nice bay view even on "garden view" price. Comfy bed. Chose the $5 food voucher over room cleaning, but just a warning that means no housekeeping visit at all-- beds left unmade. Took free shuttle to airport to catch city bus into town and avoided high overnight parking fee. Pros: nice rooms with view of bay or marina, comfy bed, close to airport, has pool/spa and restaurants, free shuttle to and from airport, free internet for 1 hr/day in business center. Cons: high priced parking if you have a car, weird not to get ANY housekeeping, have to take bus to attractions in town.

Reviews.Title: “No longer barefoot”
Reviews.Author: Ayreng
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on a business trip (although i did have a couple days to play). This was my first visit to San Diego and your Hotel made my stay all the more fabulous. The room was kept clean throughout my stay and all of the staff were helpful and pleasant. I flew back to Sacramento and realized i left a rather expensive pair of shoes in the room. I called and left a message for "Lost and Found" and withing a few hours Nicholas had returned my call and got the ball rolling to get my shoes back to me. Within 3 days i had them back. It was just one more wonderful experience that your hotel provide me with. Thank you Nicholas.... Thank You Sheraton. Ayren

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Far Away”
Reviews.Author: aspataro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel more than a few times, using Priceline of course. Even though it seems its close to downtown, it really isn't. It is however across the street from the airport, so it would be very convenient for someone just flying into the city for the first time. The hotel is clean, has a beautiful view of the San Diego bay, and the staff is pretty nice, but at times non existent. The rooms are pretty nice, and they make you feel like you are staying on a boat (very nautical). The only issues with the hotel is that the parking is fairly expensive ($25 a night), even though its nowhere near downtown, so why charge downtown prices?! I would still stay there again, and that's because of the value your getting compared to the costs that you pay compared to hotels downtown, but then again you have to take a little value away for location.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Cater for Children”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice Hotel in a location that is betwixt and between. Not really within walking distance of any facilities (cafes, shops etc) but has a beautiful outlook over the Marina. Very handy to the airport though, if you are flying in. Our room faced the Marina so aircraft noise was not a problem. May be different on airport side. The TV selection is skewed towards business with very few Childrens channels. Glad we had a room at the main building as the other section was quite a distance. Must mention Rocio as she was a standout server.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staycation!!!”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday weekend, we lucked out with priceline. This hotel has been in SD for a while and we were a little apprehensive. We heard about the renovation and it was fantastic!!! First and foremost - the option to decline housekeeping for a $5.00 voucher that can be used at the hotel (yes, Starbucks too) is BRILLIANT! Why can't every hotel do this!!! We always decline housekeeping and tidy our own room, hang towels for reuse, make our own bed, which saves the hotel $$$$ with no incentive, this place gets it! They will give you clean towels by the way, and you still get the $ 5.00 voucher! Another thing, the elevators are ample, large and fast, the elevator lobby on each floor is huge, bright, scenic and impressive, again as compared to gaslamp hotels, which seem to skimp on elevators if you ask me. The only drawback is distance from gaslamp, but this hotel made up for it. When we checked in the kind clerk said we had an economy room booked, but she promptly said she'd put us in a better room on the 6th floor, and we got a king as we had hoped for. The room is very spacious, with a downtown view, balcony, great bed and linens. Small bathroom, but well done - subway tile in shower, tub, lots of spots to hold soap, shampoo, etc., rain shower head, marble vanity with very nice lighting. Flat screen TV, high ceilings, very nice. Super, super quiet, even with airport across the street! The pool set it apart from other gaslamp hotels. It was really awesome. Overlooking the marina, tons of space, lots of lounge chairs, big pool, sunny, cabana bar, really great for downtown SD. The hotel lobby is great, computer kiosks with internet, cozy, modern. Starbucks in lobby is great. Parking at $ 22.00 for self park in lot that is part dirt is ridiculous. If you self park, be sure to bring room key to let yourself out of unattended parking lot! We had to re-park, go to lobby, get another key, just to exit the parking lot! A drag. We loved this hotel. The spacious grounds, spacious rooms, pool, we hope to stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sacrifice convenience for quality”
Reviews.Author: lumbarlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend with my 10 year old daughter. I got a good rate for the hotel for under $100 a night at Priceline so I thought. First of all from the reviews I expected the Marina Tower to be a better fit so asked for an upgrade and got one from the desk agent at an unexpected extra $20 a night. Now the Marina tower is nice because it has a restaraunt, bar, starbucks and heated pool along with full service gym. However if you want a bigger room and in my opinion better views stay at the Bay tower. They have a basic lobby but if you don't need all the ammenities I previously mentioned then that place is probably the better location. The bay tower is serviced by a free shuttle. I would stay at the bay tower next time. As far as transportation service. My daughter and I relied on public transportation. The shuttle takes you to the airport where you catch the bus. Since we relied on public transportation this place was not convenient. If you plan to travel the same way choose a place closer to the hub of transportation (downtown). I rented a car the last day and found free parking on the pennisula. This is closer to the bay tower and is a cheap way to park your car. Be advised there are only about 15 free parking spaces that are 3 hour time limit but free all night after 11. All and all the hotel is nice but I wouldn't stay here if you plan on exploring San Diego. We had a "Go Card" so that is what we did. I would like to thank "Angelique" at the front desk for her professional and kind service in dealing with the charges for my room. Noise is not an issue. PLenty of computers at business center so WIFI is not necessary

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: klee611
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hotwire and stayed one night at this hotel in San Diego. It is conveniently located near the airport and offers a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. My room was spacious and had a nice view of the bay. Overall it was a pleasant stay. The only negative I saw was the hotel has two separate towers, the Bay and Marina Towers. My room was located in the Bay tower which is not connected to the main hotel where most of the amenities are located. It was a 3-4 minute walk to the other tower where the pool, main restaurant, Starbucks and fitness room were located.
